loans.name: Heidy Thalia

texts.es:
HEIDY THALIA V. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LORETO” vive en el Jr comandante suares Nº 620, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 28 años de edad, 02 hermosos hijos menores de edad y su esposo trabaja en un aserradero.

Ella y su madre trabajan juntas en el negocio de comidas tìpicas  por las tardes y noches, venden juanes, tacacho, y pescado asado y con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, se implemento con una parrilla, e insumos, como vive en una zona bien concurrida el negocio le ha salido muy bien.

La buena atención que la caracteriza ha hecho que tenga muchos clientes y ha sido necesario incrementar su capital.  Con este préstamo  de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en ampliar su negocio, comprará mesas, sillas e insumos para la elaboración de sus platos.  Asì mismo hará arreglos en su local.

Dice que Manuela Ramos es la institución que confía en ella y el negocio que tiene le permite costear los gastos del colegio de sus hijos, además de su casa.
texts.en:
Heidy Thalia V. V. belongs to the "Loreto" Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Pucallpa. She is 28 years old, has two beautiful young children, and her husband works in a sawmill. She and her mother work together in a restaurant during afternoons and evenings. They sell juanes (a local rice and meat dish cooked in a banana leaf), tacaho (grilled plantain) and grilled fish. With the first loan of 300 soles, she started with a grill and inputs. As she lives in a busy business area, her business has gone well. The good service she provides has brought in many customers, and she needs to increase her capital. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will expand her business, and purchase tables, chairs and ingredients to make her dishes. She will also make repairs to her space. She says that Manuela Ramos is the institution that believed in her and her business, and allowed her to cover the costs of her children's education and her home.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs and inputs

loans.name: Vahobzhon

texts.ru: Год назад Вахобчон получал займ КИВА и полученный займ положительно подействовал на ход его бизнеса. Оборотный капитал увеличился и расширился ассортимент товаров. Сам Вахобчон нашел хорошую работу и в торговле занимаются его жена и дети. Для расширения своего бизнеса Вахобчон собирается и дальше получать новые займы и так как его планы вполне реалистичны то он надеется получить хорошую прибыль и улучшить условия своей жизни.
texts.en:
The loan Vahobzhon received from Kiva last year has had a real positive impact on the development of his business. He has increased his working capital and expanded inventory. Vahobzhon found good work, and his wife and children are also working in sales. He plans to continue to take out new loans to expand his business, and as his goals are quite realistic he hopes to earn a good income and improve his quality of life.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Tilobat

texts.ru: Тилобат работает преподавателем в средней общеобразовательной школе. Она преподает английский язык. Ей 41 год, замужем, имеет 3 детей. В свободные дни покупает косточки от абрикосов, перерабатывает их и потом продает. Кроме того занимается откормом скота дома, в чем помогает ее муж и старший сын. Для развития своего бизнеса Тилобат решила подать заявку на займ КИВА и собирается купить абрикосовые косточки оптом.
texts.en:
Tilobat teaches English at a public middle school. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. On days off she buys apricot pits to process and sell. She also raises livestock at home, which her husband and older son help with. To expand her business Tilobat decided to apply for a loan from Kiva. She plans to buy apricot pits wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Shoista

texts.ru: Шоиста вместе с мужем занимается куплей продажей скота на местных рынках. Нигде не работает, основной доход получает от предпринимательства. Шоисте 47 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Старший сын находится в России на заработках. Шоиста и ее муж выходят на рынок каждую неделю и покупают скотину. Тут же на рынке продают купленный скот, а иногда привозят скот домой. Условия для содержания скотины дома имеются и после недели двух выводят на рынок и продают. Шоиста подала заявку на займ и собирается увеличить свой оборотный капитал.
texts.en:
Shoista buys and sells livestock at local markets with her husband. She is not employed, so her entrepreneurship produces her primary income. Shoista is 47 years old, married, and has four children. Her oldest son is away working in Russia. Shoista and her husband go to the market each week to buy livestock. They sell those animals at the same market, or sometimes bring them home. They have a place to keep livestock at home, and after two weeks they take the animals back to the market to be sold. Shoista applied for a loan to increase their working capital.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Hairinisso

texts.ru: Хайриниссо работает уборщицей в средней общеобразовательной школе. Опыт работы ее уже больше 30 лет. Хайриниссо 59 лет и она имеет 9 детей. Кроме работы в школе она открыла маленький магазинчик при школе, где работает ее младшая дочь. Ее старший сын работает в России. Недавно он приехал в гости домой. В семье было проведено семейное мероприятие и были потрачены семейные сбережения. Для того чтобы приобрести билет на поездку Хайриниссо решила подать заявку на КИВА. Полученный займ она собирается погашать из своей зарплаты и доходов от магазинчика.
texts.en:
Hairinisso is a janitor at a middle school. She has more than 30 years of experience. She is 59 years old and has 9 children. In addition to working at the school she also opened a small shop near the school, which her daughter works in. Her oldest son works in Russia, but he recently came home to visit. The family used their saving to celebrate together. Hairinisso decided to apply to Kiva for a loan to buy him a ticket for his trip . She plans to repay the loan from her salary and income from the shop.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Son's travel costs

loans.name: Marohathon

texts.ru: Марохатхон несколько последних лет занимается предпринимательством. Ее муж тоже работает и по выходным дням помогает своей жене по бизнесу. Постоянного места для торговли у нее нету и ей приходится сидеть на центральном рынке там, где есть свободное место. Она продает различные мелкие товары: носки, носовые платки, нитки для шитья и тп. Марохатхон является клиентом МикроИнвест  уже несколько лет. За время сотрудничества она значительно улучшила свой бизнес и свои социальные условия. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ и улучшить ассортимент своих товаров.
texts.en:
Marohathon has been doing business for the last several years. Her husband also works and helps his wife in the business on the weekends. She does not have a permanent vendor location and she has to take a place which is available on the central market. She sells different kinds of small items: socks, handkerchiefs, threads for sewing and etc. Marohathon has been a client of MicroInvest for several years. During this time she has considerably improved her business and her living conditions. Right now she plans to get a new loan and increase the variety of her offered products.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Fatto

texts.ru: Фатто 49 лет, женат и имеет 3 детей. Не имеет постоянной работы и поэтому занимается куплей продажей скота на местных рынках. Его жена тоже сидит дома и помогает мужу, когда он не может продать скот на рынке и приводит его домой. Тогда жена кормит скотину, смотрит за ней и на следующем рынке Фатто продает ее. Кроме скотины, которой Фатто занимается куплей продажей, дома он держит свою собственную скотину тоже. Для расширения своего бизнеса Фатто обратился в МикроИнвест и получив займ стал покупать больше скота и увеличил свою прибыль. Свой новый займ Фатто собирается также пустить на увеличения своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Fatto is 49 years old, married and has 3 children. Because he does not hold a permanent job, Fatto is involved in buying and selling livestock at local markets. His wife stays at home and helps her husband. She brings unsold livestock home from the markets. She also feeds the livestock and takes care of it until Fatto sells it at the next market. Fatto wants to expand his business and requested this loan from MicroInvest in order to purchase additional livestock and increase his profits.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Zoidchon

texts.ru: Зоидчон работает на местном заводе по производству строительных материалов. Работа постоянная и хорошо оплачивается. Зоидчону 31 год, женат и имеет 1 ребенка. Жена нигде не работает и сидит дома, воспитывает ребенка. Для того чтобы иметь дополнительную прибыль Зоидчон держит несколько голов мелкого скота. Ему помогает его жена. Зоидчон покупает скот на рынках, в случае хорошей цены тут же продает, а если не получиться продать приводит домой. Через несколько недель продав скот Зоидчон получает прибыль. Сейчас он подал заявку на КИВА и собирается прикупить немного корма для скота.
texts.en:
Zoidchon works at a local building materials manufacturing plant. This is a permanent and well-paid job. Zoidchon is 31 years old, married and has one child. His wife does not work and takes care of their child at home. In order to subsidize his income, Zoidchon owns several heads of small livestock. His wife helps him with this business. Zoidchon buys livestock at markets and, either resells it right away, if the price is right, or brings the livestock home. He then sells this livestock after a few weeks and makes a profit. Zoidchon requested this loan from Kiva to buy feed for his livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock feed

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Робия сейчас находится на заслуженном отдыхе и получает пенсию. Пенсия небольшая и ее хватает только на покрытие мелких расходов семьи. Бюджет семьи складывается из пенсии Робии и ее сыновей. Ей 58 лет, замужем и имеет 5 детей. По выходным дням выходит на рынок и занимается куплей продажей скота. Ей помогают ее старшие сыновья. Для увеличения оборотного капитала своего бизнеса решила подать заявку на займ КИВА.
texts.en:
Robiya is currently retired and receives a pension. However, her pension is so small that it only covers the family’s minor expenses. Her family budget consists of Robiya’s pension and money from her sons. She is 58 years old, married and has 5 children. On weekends, Robiya goes to a market and buys and sells livestock. Her older sons help her with this business. Robiya wants to increase her business revolving capital and requested a loan from Kiva for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Umar

texts.ru: Умар занимается несколькими видами предпринимательства. По базарным дням занимается куплей продажей хозяйственных товаров. Умару 47 лет, женат и имеет 3 детей. В его бизнесе ему помогают его старшие сыновья. За товаром ездит он сам на оптовые рынки раз в неделю, а в течении оставшихся дней продает товар на рынках. Кроме этого дома его жена смотрит за домашней скотиной и раз в 2-3 месяца Умар продает скот на рынках и это тоже приносит ему дополнительную прибыль. Для развития бизнеса Умару понадобился небольшой займ и он решил обратиться в КИВА и получить здесь займ.
texts.en:
Umar is 47 years old, married and has 3 children. He is involved in several types of entrepreneurships. During market days, Umar is involved in buying and selling household goods. His older sons help him with the business. He travels to wholesale markets himself to obtain his goods once per week and sells the goods at markets during the rest of the weekdays. Besides this, Umar’s wife looks after farm animals at home, and Umar sells them at markets 2-3 times per month. This business brings in additional income. Umar needs a small loan to develop his business, so he decided to request the loan from Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар и его мама занимаются предпринимательством. Диловару 26 лет, имеет 1 ребенка. Каждый день с утра они выходят на рынок и раскладывают товар для продажи. За товаром ездит мама Диловара, а он в это время продает его. По выходным дням когда очень много покупателей жена Диловара также выходит на рынок и помогает в торговле. Для расширения своего бизнеса Диловар решил обратиться на КИВА и получить здесь займ. Собирается приобрести новый ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Dilovar is 26 years old, married and has a child. Together with his mother, Dilovar is involved in an entrepreneurship. Every morning, they come out to a market and set out goods for sale. While Dilovar’s mother travels to obtain the goods, he sells at the market. On weekends, when customer traffic is especially high, Dilovar’s wife also goes to the market and helps with the sales. Dilovar decided to request a loan from Kiva in order to expand his business. He plans to purchase a new assortment of products.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru: Улугбек молодой парень 36 лет, женат и имеет 3 детей. Имеет постоянную работу на местном заводе по производству строительных материалов. Заработная плата хорошая и на проживание ему и его родителям, с которыми он проживает, хватает. Но так как у него очень хорошие условия для содержания скота его отец попросил его купить ему несколько голов скотины. Запасов корма, которые есть дома, хватают на содержание и поэтому сейчас у Улугбека 4 бычка. Он подал заявку на займ КИВА и собирается приобрести еще одного бычка.
texts.en:
Ulugbek is 36 years old, married and has 3 children. He has a permanent job at the local building materials manufacturing plant. His pay is good and is enough to support himself and his parents, who live with him. However, because Ulugbek has very conditions for keeping livestock, his father asked Ulugbek to buy him several heads of livestock. He has enough livestock feed at home to support 4 bulls that Ulugbek owns. He requested this loan from Kiva to purchase one more bull.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of a bull

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно 39 лет, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Работает она преподавателем в местной школе. В данный момент муж находится на заработках в России. Присылаемые им деньги Барно частью тратит на содержание семьи, часть откладывает,  а также она приобрела несколько голов мелкого скота. Сейчас у нее достаточно запасов корма и с помощью детей она смотрит за ними. Это приносит в семью дополнительный доход. Свой займ КИВА Барно собирается потратить на приобретение еще одного бычка.
texts.en:
Barno is 39 years old, married and has two children. She works as a teacher in the local school. At this time her husband is working in Russia. Barno uses part of the money which he sends to support the family and saves the other part. She also bought several heads of small cattle. Right now she has enough fodder and with the help of her children she takes care of the cattle. This brings an additional income to the family. Barno wants to use this Kiva loan to buy one more calf.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Madinahon

texts.ru: Мадинахон 26 лет. еще незамужем. Закончив школу, она стала работать на местном консервном заводе, который производит консервированные овощи и фрукты. Работа сезонная и сейчас завод начинает подготовку к летнему сезону. Работа тяжелая но хорошо оплачивается. Кроме работы Мадинахон и ее старшие братья занимаются откормом скота дома. У ее родителей имеется участок земли на которой каждый год они выращивают разные корма и поэтому проблем с кормом у нее нет. Мадинахон знает про КИВА и поэтому решила подать заявку на займ и собирается прикупить бычка.
texts.en:
Madinahon is 26 years old; she is not married yet. After finishing school she started working at the local canning factory which produces canned vegetables and fruits. The job is seasonal and right now the factory is starting to get ready for the summer season. The job is difficult but pays well. In addition, to her job Madinahon and her older brothers raise livestock at home. Her parents have a plot of land on which they grow a variety of feed every year and because of this she does not have problems with feed. Modinahon know about KIVA and because of this decided to apply for a loan and plans to purchase a bull.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bull

loans.name: Abduhalil

texts.ru: Абдухалилу 59 лет, женат и имеет 4 детей. Нигде не работает, так как находится на пенсии. Чтобы получить дополнительный доход занимается выпечкой национального таджикского хлеба – лепешек на дому. Продает лепешки его жена на рынке. Кроме выпечки лепешек также занимается откормом скота. Абдухалил решил подать заявку на КИВА и собирается прикупить муку, так как цена на нее немного растет.
texts.en:
Abduhalil is 59 years old; he is married and has 4 children. He does not have a job, because he is retired. In order to earn additional income he bakes tradition Tajik bread – flatbread, at home. His wife sells the flatbread at the market. In addition to baking flatbread he fattens livestock. Abduhalil decide to apply on KIVA and plans to purchase flour because prices are growing a little bit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour at wholesale

loans.name: Садриддин

texts.ru: Садриддину исполнилось 29 лет, женат и имеет 2 детей. После окончания школы не нашел постоянной работы и поэтому он выехал в Россию на заработки. Проработав несколько лет он приехал на родину и купил здесь машину, на которой стал заниматься частными перевозками – такси. Основной доход семьи у него от этого вида деятельности. Кроме этого занимается куплей продажей скота на местных рынках. Также у него дома несколько голов скота за которыми смотрит его жена. Садриддин подал заявку на займ КИВА и собирается увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Sadriddin turned 29 years old; he is married and has 2 children. After finishing school he did not find permanent employment and because of this traveled to Russia to earn money. Having worked for several years he returned to the motherland and bought a car here, on which he provides private transport – a taxi. The family’s main income is this business. In addition, he also purchases and sells livestock at the local markets. Also, he has several heads of livestock at home, which are taken care of by his wife. Sadriddin applied for a loan on KIVA and plans to increase his livestock headcount.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru: Саёхат 45 лет, замужем и имеет 4 детей. Старший сын находится на заработках в России.  Саёхат работает в санатории Зумрад, который широко известен как в Таджикистане, так и за его пределами. Работа постоянная и Саёхат занята здесь всю неделю. По выходным дням вместе со своим мужем Саёхат занимается куплей продажей мелкого рогатого скота на рынках. Сейчас цены на скот приемлемые и поэтому торговля идет хорошо. Узнав про КИВА Саёхат решила подать заявку на займ и немного расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Sayohat is 45 years old; she is married and has 4 children. Her oldest son is earning money in Russia. Sayohat works at the Zumrad sanatorium which is widely known both in Tajikistan and outside its borders. The job is permanent and Sayohat is busy there all week. On the weekends, together with her husband Sayohat purchases and sells small, horned livestock at the markets. Right now, livestock prices are acceptable and this is why sales are going well. Having found out about KIVA, Sayohat decided to apply for a loan and to expand her business a little bit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастуре 43 года, имеет 2 детей. Ее муж умер несколько лет назад и вся тяжесть по воспитанию детей лежит на ее плечах. Постоянной работы Мастура не имеет и занимается предпринимательством на рынке. Основной ассортимент товаров это носки – мужские, женские и детские. За товаром ездит раз в неделю, пять дней торгует, а 1 день у нее выходной. Мастура сотрудничает с МикроИнвест уже почти 4 года и показала себя ответственным клиентом. Сейчас она подала заявку на КИВА и собирается увеличить свой капитал.
texts.en:
Mastura is 43 years old and has 2 children. Her husband passed away several years ago and all the weight of raising children lies on her shoulders. Mastura does not have a permanent job and is an entrepreneur at the market. Her main products are socks – men’s, women’s, and children’s. She travels for products once a week, sells five days a week, and 1 day a week is her day off. Mastura has been working with MicroInvest for almost 4 years and has shown herself to be a responsible client. Right now she has applied on KIVA and plans to increase her working capital.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Abdulafis

texts.ru: Хотя Абдулафису 62 года он совмещает в себе несколько профессий. По профессии агроном он работает начальником в госучреждении, также дома он имеет парник, где выращивает различные овощи. Кроме того арендует землю, где выращивает различные сельскохозяйственные культуры. У Абдулафиса очень большая семья, кроме его жены у него 7 детей. Старшие дети уже имеют свои семьи. Чтобы прокормить свою семью Абдулафис откармливает дома скотину, для чего имеет хорошие условия. Для увеличения поголовья скота Абдулафис решил подать заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Even though Abdulafis is 62 years old he combines several professions. He is an agronomist by profession and works as a manager at a government organization. Also, at home he has a greenhouse where he grows different vegetables. In addition, he rents land where he grows different agricultural crops. Abdulafis has a very big family; in addition to his wife he has 7 children. The older children already have their own families. In order to feed his family Abdulafis fattens livestock at home, for which he has good conditions. In order to increase his livestock headcount, Abdulafis decided to apply to KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Abdumutalib

texts.ru: У Абдумуталиба необычная профессия – он точильщик ножей. Каждый день с утра до вечера работает на рынке – точит ножи, ножницы и другие инструменты. Доход небольшой но другого занятия у Абдумуталиба нет. Кроме этого он и его отец откармливают скотину дома. Недавно семья Абдумуталиба решила женить его младшего сына и поэтому понадобилась небольшая сумма денег. Абдумуталиб решил обратиться за ними в МикроИнвест и оформил заявку на займ. Данный займ собирается погасить в течении 3 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdumutalib has an unusual profession – he sharpens knives. Every day from morning until evening he works at the market – sharpens knives, scissors and other tools. The income is not big, but Abdumutalib does have another occupation. In addition, he and his father fatten livestock at home. Recently, Abdumutalib’s family decided to marry off his younger son and this is why he needed a small sum of money. Abdumutalib decided to turn to MicroInvest for it and filled out a loan application. He plans to pay back the loan quickly.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wedding

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
"My parents are farmers that is why I know everything how to plant rice seedlings and harvest the grains. My husband and I are tenants. We till the land of our friend which we use to earn a living for all our family needs. Until now, we are still tenants but we never stop dreaming that someday, we will be able to buy our farm," says Mary Grace R., a 32-year-old mother of three children.

She would like to ask for a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase seeds, urea and complete fertilizers. She is also interested in venturing into another line of business.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. They provide not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, urea and complete fertilizers

loans.name: Sarvar

texts.ru: Сарвару 31 год, женат имеет 2 детей. Постоянной работы не имеет и поэтому несколько лет назад он стал работать у одного мастера и обучаться профессии мастера отделочника. Прошло несколько лет и Сарвар стал заниматься отделкой квартир и домов самостоятельно. Сейчас у него есть 2 ученика с которыми он берет заказы и занимается отделкой домов и частных квартир. Когда он получает заказ, то покупает строительные материалы. После окончания работ он получает оплату и на эти доходы кормит свою семью. Сейчас он подал заявку на займ КИВА и собирается приобрести краски и цемент для продолжения своих работ.
texts.en:
Sarvar is 31 years old, married and has two children. Because he does not have a permanent job, he started his master decorator apprenticeship several years ago. Few years passed, and Sarvar became involved in decorating apartments and houses on his own. He currently has two apprentices, who help him complete orders decorating houses and apartments. When he receives an order, Sarvar buys building materials. He gets paid once work is completed and uses this income to support his family. Sarvar requested this loan from Kiva and plans to buy paint and cement needing to continue his work.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Azima

texts.ru: Азиме 48 лет, имеет 3 детей. Несколько лет назад у нее умер муж. Азима занимается куплей продажей детской одежды. Ей помогает ее невестка. Кроме того ее старший сын занимается ремонтом легковых машин. Азима ездит за товаром на оптовый рынок и потом продает в розницу на местном рынке. В МикроИнвест получает свой первый займ и собирается расширить ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Azima is 48 years old and has three children. Her husband died several years ago. Azima is involved in the sales of children’s clothing. Her daughter-in-law helps her with the business. Besides this, Azima’s oldest son repairs passenger cars. Azima travels to a wholesale market for her merchandise and then sells the goods retail at a local market. This is her first loan at MicroInvest. She plans to use it to expand her goods assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of goods assortment

loans.name: Tsog

texts.en:
Tsog T. has been running a butcher stall in the local food market since 1998. He usually purchases beef from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar and packages the meat in smaller portions for individual sale. He has more than ten years of experience in the business and his butcher stall is distinguished from other retailers in that he uses hygienic plastic packages for his meat retail.

Tsog lives with his wife and his infant child in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Tsog remarried three years ago. His wife is currently attending university. Tsog would like to work with his wife, once she is done school, and open another butcher shop. Tsog requests a loan to purchase more meat from the wholesale markets for his business.

loans.use: To purchase meat from the wholesale markets

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en:
Oyunbileg Luvsan has a small butcher stall in the Huchit Shonhor market, one of the largest food markets in Ulaanbaatar. Since the beginning of her business in 2000, she has been selling fresh meat that she purchases from the wholesale markets. Her husband drives his truck to purchase and bring meat from the wholesale markets located outside the city.

Oyunbileg lives with her husband and two children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her older daughter is a 6th grader in the local high school and her younger daughter is just 4 months old. She and her family live in a ger (a round, nomadic tent). Her family is working hard to build a new home on their land in the near future. She requests a loan to purchase more meat from the wholesale markets for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat from the wholesale markets

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun C. is 26-year-old, married woman and is the mother of lovely one teenage child who is enrolled in the local school. She currently distills rice wine and sells to the people who buy in bulk. To earn additional income, she also uses the leftover of distilling wine to raise pigs. The other source of the family’s income, her husband repairs both, bicycle and motorcycle in their workshop front of their house. Because the repairing-vehicle business is a profitable for family, Sun C. requests a loan of $800 for her husband to purchase more spare parts and repairing materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts and repairing materials

loans.name: Amor Y Paz - Group 2

texts.en:
Rosa Y. is the group leader of these five entrepreneurs. She has four children, ages 5, 9, 10, and 17. Despite the fact that Rosa did not complete elementary school, her business skills are remarkable. She maintains three trades: vending fried food, selling clothing, and running her small "colmado" (convenience store).

Rosa will use her loan to buy the most commonly needed products for her store: rice, beans, oil, sugar, coffee, herbs, and spices. Most people in her community buy small amounts of provisions daily because they do not have refrigerators to store food: in other words, they buy whatever they will cook the same day. Rosa wants to continue to cater to her current demand as well as to draw new customers to her store.

Rosa, as a smart businesswoman, thinks big. In the future, she'd like to own her own warehouse, and be a supplier to small stores like the one she runs today. She thinks this will allow her to provide much better for her family and to extend her business to other communities.

On behalf of this group of entrepreneurs, thank you for supporting this Kiva loan!

loans.use: To purchase saleable merchandise

loans.name: Jecebel

texts.en:
"I wanted to have our own farm. My husband and I are tenants to Mr. Oliver, a friend for a long time, who helps us farm and harvest rice for our family. Our agreement is sharing. During harvest time, they give us sacks of rice, depends on the total harvest, as payment for our labor of love," says Jecebel A., a 35-year-old mother of three children.

She would like a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy urea fertilizers and herbicides. The loan will truly help her improve her yield and have better income for the family.

CEVI provides its clients with more than just loans. They also give training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase urea fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Mr. Hak C., 47, sells used motorbikes that he buys from people who live in rural areas. He buys motors at the cheapest price, cleans them up, and sells them at profit. The profit he gets from selling motorbikes is what he uses to feed his family. He is a responsible man who has provided for all his family's needs. Hak C. is the leader of three other family members. His wife is a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals for the family and cares for the children. Due to lack of capital needed to run the business more successfully, Hak C. would like a $1000 loan from Kiva to buy additional used motorcycles for sale.

loans.use: To buy additional used motorcycles

loans.name: Chak

texts.en: Chak P. is a 36-year-old widowed mother of three children who are still young and enrolled in school. She makes a living working as a garment worker in the garment industry in Phnom Penh City. Additionally, she also cultivates a rice crop during the farming season. The rice-farming season is coming and Chak P. is lacking fertilizer to grow a rice crop. Thus, she is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizers for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Suzzette

texts.en:
"I have been praying always to have an abundant harvest. My husband and I wanted to buy another farm, but what we have now is not enough to buy the land we want to till," says Suzzete L., a 28-year old mother of two children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to purchase complete fertilizers, herbicides and ammonium sulfate. The loan will really help a lot, especially with improving their harvest.

CEVI aims to help small business grow. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers, herbicides and ammonium sulfate

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
"I am lucky and blessed that I have a husband who is responsible and always looks out for the best for our children. We started tilling a 1 hectare farm. We tried to save to be able to buy another farm. However, it will cost an arm and a leg for my family to buy land since people are selling it at a high cost," says Elizabeth P., the mother of four children.
She would like to ask for a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase urea fertilizers, seeds and herbicides. The loan will truly help improve their harvest and income as well. 
Through CEVI, Mrs. P. has been able to sustain her livelihood. Now she is a loyal client of CEVI and receives not just loans but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase urea fertilizers, seeds and herbicides

loans.name: Pech's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of five women. Its leader, S., is age 30, married with three children who are studying in the local public school. She currently works as a garment worker for a factory located near her house. The other source of the family's income comes from her husband's salary of $70 a month. He works as a local military policeman. Since her roof is cracking during the rainy season, S. has decided to seek a loan in order to repair it.

The other four borrowers are: P. is a fruit seller, who is applying for a loan to expand her business. S. is a staff member for an association and she is looking for a loan to finish building her house. S. is a garment worker, who is requesting a loan to buy a used motorbike for riding to work. S. works as a seamstress in a garment factory and she is applying for a loan to purchase a motorbike to ride to work. All of the borrowers are people living in Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To repair the old roof of a house

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily G. makes a living mainly from buying and selling flowering plants. She is 46 years old, widowed and has four adult children. She is from the village of Talisay, Malaubang, Ozamiz City. Lily has been in business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lily joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lily is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase different kinds of flowering plants. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family's basic needs.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase flowers

loans.name: Saven

texts.en:
Mrs. Saven K. is a villager in Khpuos Kraom village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for living. Aside from this, she is a Khmer noodle seller who makes a small income to support the family. Her husband, Mr. Thorn Sarith, helps her in rice farming. She is 32 years old and the mother of two children: one of whom is attending the local school. The younger one is 3 years old. 
Although they work hard, they still do not earn enough money to support the family. Mrs. Saven K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to build a house for her family. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a house

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie L. owns and operates a business growing and selling flowering plants. She is from the village of Talisay, Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 adult children. Emelie has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Emelie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Emelie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Emelie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to buy flowering plants. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for her children's education.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy flowers

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en: Nyamsuren B. is a 41-year-old single mother who has two children. Her husband died three years ago. Since her husband's death, she has been running a dressmaking business. Nyamsuren makes traditional clothing such as deels, vests and belts. Her younger sister sells the clothes at her clothing stall in the local market. With her profit, Nyamsuren pays her elder daughter's university tuition. This child is studying in Erdenet city, which is 380 kilometers north of the capital city. Nyamsuren lives with her younger child in a ger (traditional nomadic tent) district on a plot of land her younger sister owns in the capital city, Ulaanbaatar. Her wish is to help her daughter graduate successfully from university and start a good life. Nyamsuren also hopes to have her own plot of land to live on. She requests a loan to purchase a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar Mushtaq Group

texts.en:
Nargis baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (pipes and taps) for her sanitary supplies selling business. Nishat baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Voilet baji wants a loan to buy an embroidering machine for preparing embroidered dresses.

Shamim akhtar baji is a widow and lives in the historic part of the city of Lahore named Yadgar, Pakistan. Her husband died from a heart attack and left her alone in this world. She gathered her courage to face the circumstances. She started a business selling clothes. She buys clothes from her native city Lahore and sells to the clothing shops and in the community. She has 6 years of experience in this business.

She is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her clothes selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar Muhammad Akram Group

texts.en:
Shamim Akhtar Baji is a widow residing in the historical site of Yadgar in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband died 3 years ago from an accident. Shamim Baji never loses her courage and fights with her circumstances. She started a clothes selling business. She chose this business because she knows that in Lahore people are fond of clothes. Through this business, she is able to pay her utilities easily. Nowadays, she is out of stock but she has a good number of orders. So she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to complete the orders of her customers.
Nasreen Baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.
Naseem Akhtar Baji wants a loan to buy cigarette packets to sell. The picture belongs to Naseem Akhtar Baji who is showing her cigarette packets. 
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Aslan

texts.ru: Аслан Джураев проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 24 года. Женат, имеет 2 несовершенолетних детей. По специальности Аслан является экономистом. Вот уже более 8 он занимается торговлей. Торгует он детскими игрушками и канцтоварами. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы закупить продукты питания, т.е. разнообразить свой ассортимент. На полученную прибыль, хочет сделать свадьбу сына (обрезание).
texts.en:
Aslan J., 24, lives in the Qurgan-Tube district. He is married and has two young children. By training Aslan is an economist. For over 8 years he has been working in sales. He sells children's toys and school supplies. He is requesting a loan to buy groceries to expand his inventory into foods. He wants to use the profit earned to pay for his son's circumcision.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs

loans.name: Mina

texts.en: Mrs. Mina B. is a tailor in the town of Patan. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like kurta sulwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, makhshi and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs B. took a six month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her locality. She plans to use her loan of 10,000 NPR to buy materials for her tailoring work. She wants to use the shop's income to sustain herself and for her daughter's education. In Nepal, the cost of a good education is very high. Her husband's name is Santa Man. He works in his own small shop. Her daughter is studying in pre-primary school.

loans.use: To buy materials for tailoring work

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya B. lives in a family with her husband, one son and one daughter in the town of Patan. Her husband, Mr. Sanu B., works in a steel factory. Both her son and daughter are studying in BBS level.
Mrs. B. is a farmer and she grows green vegetables on her land. Most of the farmers in Nepal are dependent on seasonal farming due to lack of modern tools and equipment. Mrs. B. sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening every day. All her family members help her with the farm work.
Now Mrs. Maiya B. is requesting a 10,000 NPR loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Rohila

texts.ru: Рохила Зуюнова более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Она продает шторы и ее принадлежности на рынке. Рохила проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 36 лет. Разведена, имеет 2 детей. Клиентка хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы закупить новые, модные шторы. На полученную прибыль хочет купить детям компьютер, чтобы их обучить.
texts.en:
Rohila Z. has worked in retail for over 5 years. She sells draperies and their accessories at the market. Rohila lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 36 years old, divorced, and has two children. She is seeking a loan to buy new, fashionable drapes. She wants to use the income earned to buy her children a computer for them to learn on.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Kiran Hafiz Ali Group

texts.en:
Kiran baji is married to H. A., and they have been living in a historical place named Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan, since past 10 years. Her husband is a cobbler who earns income by taking orders from the shoe companies. Kiran baji also helps him by fixing the heels of shoes. Her husband has five years of experience in this business. She is applying for a loan to buy materials (leather, nails) for her husband's shoe-making business. She is joined by three other group members.

Sonia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Parveen Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. Neelam Shahzadi baji wants a loan to buy computer spare parts to sell.

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for shoe-making business

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Mrs. Bina M. is a cosmetic shopkeeper in the village of Thecho. She opened her cosmetic shop a year ago to utilize her free time and to upgrade her family’s living standard. She sells different kinds of cosmetic goods in her shop. Now she seeks Rs10,000 loan to invest in her shop. She will use the loan to buy various types of cosmetic goods such as creams, lipsticks, glass bangles, etc.

Mrs. Bina M. has three members including herself in her family. Her husband Mr. Ramesh works in a small office. His income is not enough to meet the family expenses.

loans.use: to buys cosmetic goods to sell

loans.name: Saut

texts.en: Saut H. is 56 years old and a resident of the Pursat Province, where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice and some vegetable crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a widowed mother of five children, all of whom are single and help her with the farm work. Saut H. and her children work hard at their farming activity every day and never waste time. She is a sacrificing lady who tries to earn money to sustain her family and desires that all her children attain suitable jobs. To assist her with the hard physical labor required in farming, Saut H. is applying for a loan to buy a water buffalo for plowing the fields and to buy more fertilizers to grow crops.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo for plowing the fields and buy more fertilizers to grow crops

loans.name: Sanu Thapa

texts.en:
Mrs. Sanu Thapa M. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishepati, Lalitpur. Sainbu-Bhaishepati is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. Sanu Thapa M. lives in a family with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Rajendra Thapa M., is a farmer. Her older son is studying in grade 8 and her younger son is in grade 6.
Mrs. Sanu is engaged in selling cow’s milk. She already owns two cows and makes sales in her neighborhood. Nowadays the demand for cow’s milk is increasing constantly in the region. To meet the demands of the customers, she needs another young dairy cow. So, she is requesting a loan of 30,000 NPR to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy another young dairy cow

loans.name: Noreen Muhammad Zulfiqar Group

texts.en:
Noreen Baji is a wife of M. Z., living in the historical site of Yadgar, in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband runs a laundry business in the community. He has been in this profession for the past four years. Noreen Baji also helps him by washing clothes. She is applying for a loan to buy washing supplies such as washing powder and bleach for her husband's laundry.
Jamila Baji and Sana Baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. 
Rahmat Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a laundry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more seed for his farm

loans.name: Puna

texts.en:
Mrs. Puna G. lives in Balkhu in the Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses. Mrs. G. lives in a single family with her husband and three children. Her husband, Mr. Jagath man G., is a taxi driver. She has one son and two daughters. Her son took the SLC (Schooling Leaving Certificate) exam this year and both her daughters are studying at the primary level.

Mrs. G. is a grocery shopkeeper in Balkhu. She opened her grocery store five years ago to strengthen the economic conditions of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods in her shop. To meet the increasing demand for grocery goods, she is requesting a Rs 25000.00 loan to invest in her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Mahwish Muhammad Kamran Group

texts.en:
Mahwish baji is the wife of M. K. and has lived in a historical place, named Yadgar, of the city Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband runs a construction supplies selling business. He takes orders from the building contractors and provide them with the supplies. He has 3 years of experience in this business.

Mahwish baji is a very good natured lady. She always supports her husband in his business. She takes care of his needs and his health all the time. She is the group leader of the mentioned ladies also. She is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies to complete the orders of customers so that he keeps his reputation in the eyes of customers.

Tayyaba baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Shazia baji wants a loan to buy sports items (bats, balls) to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aybjon

texts.ru: Косимов Аюбжон проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 31 год. Женат, имеет 2 сыновей. Клиент занимается торговлей,этим видом деятельности занимается более 6 лет. Торговая точка находится в районе Рудаки.  Клиент покупает и везет товар с города Душанбе с торгового центра Садбарг.  Торговля у клиента идет хорошо , так как у него есть оптовые клиенты. Торгует он продуктами питания и хозтоварами. Аюбжон обратился к нам за повторным кредитом, чтобы увеличить товараоборот.
texts.en:
Aybjon K. lives in the Rudaki district. He is 31 years old, married, and has two sons. He works in retail, as he as for over 6 years. His store is in the Rudaki district. He buys goods and transports them from the Sadbarg shopping center in Dushanbe. Sales have been good since he has wholesale customers. He sells groceries and housewares. Aybjon came to us for another loan in order to increase sales turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Shahida Noreen Muhammad Irshad Group

texts.en:
Ghazala baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Shaista baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies to sell.

Kosar baji wants a loan to buy items (chairs, scissors, creams) for her barber shop.

Hamidan baji wants a loan to buy ready-made garments to sell.

Shahida noreen baji is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. She is a very responsible lady and a very good human being. All of her members respect her a lot. Her husband belongs to a construction supplies business. He completes the orders of building contractors and earns income. Shahida baji performs her duties as a wife and as a woman brilliantly. She is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies to complete the orders of his customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Rhina Esther

texts.es:
RHINA ESTHER E. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LORETO” con domicilio en el Jr. COMANDANTE SUARES N° 398 del distrito de Callería, tiene 47 años y 02 hijos que son independientes.

La señora vende parrilladas (carne a la parilla) todos los domingos en la vereda de su casa, desde hace buen tiempo el motor de su moto taxi viene funcionando mal lo que la obliga a hacer un nuevo préstamo.
Su primer prèstamo fue de S/. 300.00 que le ayudo a  comprar un nuevo motor.

Actualmente se dedica a administrar su mototaxi y con el préstamo  de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en la compra de un motor para un moto taxi, y además va a comprar un nuevo moto taxi que pagara en cuotas.

En el poco tiempo que esta trabajando con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rhina Esther E. A. belongs to the "Loreto" Communal Bank. She lives in the district of Callería, is 47 years old, and has two independent children. She sells grilled meats every Sunday on the path in front of her house. A while ago the engine of her motorcycle taxi began malfunctioning, so she sought a loan. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which helped her to buy a new engine. Now she is running her motorcycle taxi business, and with this loan of 2,000 soles, she will invest in another engine as well as another motorcycle, which she will repay in installments. In the short time she has worked with Manuela Ramos, she has been happy with the support it gives women so they may succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an engine and a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Um-E-Kalsoom Muhammad Afzal Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell.

Yasmeen baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy ready-made garments to sell.

Razia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Um-e-Kalsoom baji is a very hardworking lady and the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. Her husband runs a construction supplies business. He completes the orders of building contractors and earns income. Um-e-Kalsoom baji shares the financial burden with him by sewing clothes. She sews clothes of her neighbors and relatives. She is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies to complete the orders of her husband's customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Sewing machines belong to Um-e-Kalsoom baji.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Paola Antonia

texts.es:
PAOLA ANTONIA  E. H., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LORETO” vive en Jr comandante suares Nº 433, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 29 años de edad,  2 hijos menores de edad y su pareja es comerciante.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de artículos de belleza y perfumes, y con el tiempo ha cambiado de rubro, ahora vende zapatos, también tiene un moto taxi que alquila el cual le genera un ingreso mas.

Hoy, ella está progresando con su familia y el negocio de venta de zapatos se mantiene.  Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de  3 docenas de zapatos tanto para varones y mujeres  y también invertirà una parte de este dinero para la compra de otra moto taxi. 

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Paola Antonia E. H. belongs to the "Loreto" Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, is 29 years old, has two small children, and her husband is a merchant. She started a business selling beauty products and perfumes, and over time has changed fields. Now she sells shoes and rents out a motorcycle taxi, which generates additional income. Now, she is progressing with her family and maintains her shoe business. With this loan of 1,200 soles, she will purchase three dozen shoes for men and women, and she will invest part of the money in the purchase of another motorcycle taxi. She says, "Manuela Ramos is an NGO (non-governmental organization) that supports many families and I'm happy for this help."

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes of various styles and sizes; purchase one motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise his stock

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline N. is a hard-working business woman of 50 years old and is married with two children who are in the university. She has a chicken restaurant business (fried chicken) of her own. She is using the loan to purchase chicken and some necessary commodities for the restaurant where she wants to increase the daily food menu. Her dream is to prosper in the business.

loans.use: To purchase chicken and some necessary commodities for the restaurant

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita S. is a farmer in the village of Sainbu-Bhaishipati, lalitpur. She owns her own land and mostly grows seasonal vegetables in her land. She sells her vegetables in a local market in the morning and evening. Now she seeks a loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farming. By doing vegetable farming, she helps her husband with the upkeep of her family.

Mrs. S. has five members, including herself, in her family. Her husband Mr. Krishna Kumar Thapa works in his own small restaurant. She has two sons and a daughter. Her older son is studying in grade 5 and her younger son is studying in grade 3. Her daughter is only a year old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Shaheen Amjad Masih Group

texts.en:
Kako baji, Salma baji and Kalsoom baji each want a loan to buy leather to resell.

S. baji is married to A. M.. They have lived in Kasur, Pakistan, for the past 15 years. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats. Her husband belongs to a leather-selling business. He sells leather to factories and earns income. S. baji operates a shawl-selling business. She buys shawls from the city of Multan and sells them in the community. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy leather to increase the profits of her husband.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy leather to sell

loans.name: Safia Patras Masih Group

texts.en:
Safia baji lives in Kasur, Pakistan, a city famous for its sweetmeats. She is a tailor. She learned this trade from her mother and helps her family by paying the utilities. Her husband, P. M., sells leather. He receives orders from companies and sells them his product to earn income. Safia baji is applying for a loan to buy leather to help her husband complete orders for his customers.

Safia baji is the group leader for this loan, which includes two other ladies.  Hanifan baji and Rani baji each want a loan to buy leather to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy leather to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds for his farm

loans.name: Bashiran Sardar Group

texts.en:
Rahmatay baji, Maryam baji, Naseem baji and Bashiran baji each want a loan to buy leather for their leather selling business.

Bashiran baji is a wife of Mr. S. and a citizen of a city named Kasur, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband runs a leather selling business. He sells leather to the factories and earns income. Bashiran baji operates a clothes sewing business to pay off the utilities. Through her business, her husband gets some ease from the financial burden. She is applying for a loan to increase the profit of her husband's leather selling business by buying leather.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy leather to resell

loans.name: Yemkala

texts.en:
Mrs. Yemkala D. is a grocery shopkeeper in the town of Balkhu. She opened her grocery store 2 years ago to strengthen the economic condition of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, snacks, etc. in her shop. She has to expand her business and attract more customers. She is requesting for a Rs 25000 loan to expand her business.

Mrs. D. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband is a teacher and regularly helps his wife Mrs. D. in her business. Her son is studying in pre-primary school and needs more attention.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Sakina Muhammad Hussain Group

texts.en:
Naheed baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

T. baji wants a loan to buy shoe boxes to sell.

Sakina baji is the wife of M. H. and has lived in a city named Kasur, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Kasur city is famous for its sweet meat. Her husband belongs to a dairy business. Presently, they have one buffalo at their home and Sakina baji takes care of it. They both get up at 4 o'clock and get milk from the buffalo, then Mr. H. goes to the milk shops and sells the milk to them and earns income. Now they both are planning to buy another buffalo to expand their dairy business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their dairy business.

loans.name: Gun Keshari

texts.en:
Mrs. Gun Keshari M. is a grocery shopkeeper in Thecho village. She opened her grocery shop 6 years ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, pulses, biscuits and noodles in her shop. The demand for grocery goods is increasing in that area so she is requesting a loan of 30,000 Rupees to buy grocery items to meet the demand.

Mrs. Gun Keshari M. had already taken a first loan from Kiva and had cleared her loan. The previous loan helped her to raise the level of income from her shop.

Mrs. M. lives with her mother-in-law, husband and one son. Her husband is Shiva Das M. and is a farmer. Her son is studying in grade 8.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Sakina Choudary Gaman Masih Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji and Rehana baji each want a loan to buy leather to sell.

Shamim baji wants a loan to buy bricks to sell.

Muniran baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business.

Sakina baji is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. They all are citizens of a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweet meat. Sakina baji operates a kite selling business. Her business grows when the occasion of kite flying comes, because kids and even elders are fond of kite flying and they celebrate this event with enthusiasm. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband and to pay the utilities. Her husband belongs to a leather selling business. He completes the orders of factories to earn income. Sakina baji is applying for a loan to buy leather so that her husband can complete the orders of his customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy leather to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animals for his farm

loans.name: Amunu

texts.en:
Amunu J. sells local brewed alcohol and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials like yeast, pipes, etc., in order to enhance her business. She is 27 and divorced with two children who attend school at St. Bakhita Mission primary school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. Theses are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more brewing materials

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en:
F. Zebo is an enterprising woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver and his salary isn't stable, so sometimes debts would accumulate. To help her husband, Zebo decided to start her own business, designing and making national dresses for women. She began after her first child was born and started with a small machine she already owned. Now she has a small workshop and two employees that help her cover the demands of her clients. The good service and fine quality she offers has made her business grow into a small company.

Zebo wants a loan of 4800 Somoni to buy materials and repair her sewing machine so she can fill her customer's orders. The loan will help her business grow and raise the quality of life for her family. Zebo sincerely thanks you for your help.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of fabrics

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
H. Adham is a 40-year-old married man who lives with his wife and three children. He has 16 years of experience in raising and selling cattle. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Adham has become a very successful businessman. Adham has a friendly family who are always try to help each other. Thus with the cattle-raising business, his wife and elder son help him. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now Adham wants to expand his business and buy more cattle so he applied for a loan of $1,000. He thanks all lenders for their support. With your help Adham can get ahead.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
R. Bakhtiyor is working hard as he is the only breadwinner in the family. For 8 years he has been selling blankets and coverlets in the market. This market is very popular among the population because of his attractive prices. Bakhtiyor has a lot of clients. He tries to choose various goods of good quality and attractive prices which allows him to keep his clientele. R. is 32 years old, married and has four children. His wife is a housekeeper. Bakhtiyor is requesting a loan of $1500 US for purchasing more goods in order to increase the range of them. Bakhtiyor would like to thank everybody for supporting him and promises that he will repay the loan without any delay. The progress of Bakhtiyor’s business is in your hands

loans.use: To purchase blankets and coverlets

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
R. Hakim, a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur, lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan with his wife and three children. For seven years Hakim has been working in the central city market selling blankets and coverlets, a business that enjoys stability and consistent growth. Once a month he travels to the neighboring city to purchase new goods, during which time his wife substitutes for him in the market.

Hakim enjoys working for himself, and his business is the main source of income for his whole family. He is now requesting a loan of $1500 USD to purchase new inventory. We believe Hakim‘s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Hakim’s business. loans.use: To purchase additional blankets and coverlets for his business.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Юсупова Гульсара-женщина 39 лет. Замужем и мать  3-х детей. Имеет высшего образование и дополнительно работает зам.директором ООО «Барфак». Гульсара занимается продажей техники  и одеялов на рынке «Панчшанбе».Магазин берёт в аренду. Гульсара закупает товар в городе Бишкек Республики Киргизстан. Гульсаре помогает двоюродная сестра Малика. Кредит получила на расширения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Gulsara U. is 39 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a higher education and also works as an assistant director at a firm. Gulsara is involved in sales of equipment and blankets at the Panshanbe market. She leases her store. Gulsara buys her goods in the city of Bishkek in Kyrgyztan. Her cousin Malika helps with this business. Gulsara wants to use this loan for expanding her goods assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of goods assortment

loans.name: Kakembo Nulu's Group

texts.en:
Nulu operates a drugstore in Bwaise, one of Kampala's suburbs. She sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all sorts of people. She works seven days a week. Nulu buys all her drugs from Kampala Pharmaceutical Industry and uses public transport to and from shopping.

Nulu is the leader of this five member group. She is 39 years old and married with four children between 5 and 16 years old. All her children go to school. She owns a three-room house where she lives with her six immediate family members. Nulu doesn’t take care of additional family members. There is electricity and piped water in her home. The family gets three meals a day. She lives and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises.

Nulu has been in business for the last seven years. Her main challenge is the rainy season which stops her customers from coming to her. Nulu has been with MCDT for over two years and is now on her fourth loan, working all along with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more drugs and partly to pay school fees. Nulu aspires to open up another drugstore.

loans.use: To buy more drugs and partly to pay school fees

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat A., 32 years old and living with his wife and four children, has dedicated himself to farming barley, wheat, corn, tomato and watermelon for more than 13 years. Shuhrat enjoys being a farmer and finds harvesting his crops especially gratifying. On the other hand, the most tedious part of farming is the preparation of land for planting and protecting crops from insects that could spoil his harvest. This is his first loan request from IMON International, and he will use the money to buy seeds and fertilizer for his plots. Shuhrat thanks all who are supporting him.
