loans.use: To purchase seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Isia

texts.en:
Isia R., 38, sells green vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to sell. Married to a businessman who owns a shop at Juba market, Isia is the mother of four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she wants to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem S., 49 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia, earns a living as a tailor, providing her services to neighbors, sewing both traditional and modern clothes. She conducts the business very well and her many customers recognize the good service she provides. From this enterprise, she can earn an average of $9 per day. As well, she has always cultivated a rice crop.

Hem is a widow and the mother of four children; two are married and have already started families, and the others are single and still live in the family home. Hem S. is applying for a loan to purchase a plot of farmland in order to grow a rice crop during the approaching rainy season.

loans.use: To grow a rice crop during the approaching rainy season.

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth has been running her tailoring business in the Sakina neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She belongs to the Juhud group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $175. Every day, she works at her business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy a sewing machine for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Magreth is 31 years old and married, and she has an 11-year-old child. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina S. is from the town of Tudela Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Felina is married and has five school-aged children. Felina earns a living by owning and operating a dress-making business. She provides women's tailoring services to local community members. Felina has been engaged in her business for some years now and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Felina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Felina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from GDMPC. Felina is now requesting a new loan of 3,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as sewing machines, needles and thread. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Felina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business and to support her family's basic needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment such as sewing machines, needles and thread

loans.name: Simona

texts.en:
Simona R. currently sells bread, and she is requesting a loan to open up a bakery. She is married to a farmer who has grown crops in the Walang-walang river region for five years. Of their four children, two attend school at Kator primary school. With the extra profits she expects from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land on which she can build and rent out buildings in order to gain additional income.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a bakery

loans.name: Ritha

texts.en:
Ritha is a poultry keeper and has been running a tailoring business in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for three years. She belongs to the Juhud group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $250. Every day, she works at her business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy a sewing machine for her business. She hopes that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Ritha is 47 years old, married and has four children: ages 25, 23, 21 and 15. She also cares for five additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru has been a clothes seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to the Tuzinduke group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $20. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Nuru is 30 years old, married and has three children: ages 12, 10 and 3.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Pin's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of three people, all residents of Siem Reap Province. Its leader, Y., 57, is a local grocery seller, selling cooked ingredients, cane foods and some sweets for kids. She is able to make an income of around $4 each day to manage her family's daily expenses. As another source of the family income, her husband drives a motorbike taxi. The older couple has eight children, seven of whom are married and live independently and the other one is single and helps Y. sell groceries.

Y. is running her investment smoothly and has gained income. To make her business more successful, she is applying for a loan to increase the quantity of grocery item in order to meet her customer's requirements.

The other borrowers who have joined the loan are K., a local chef who wants to buy a motorcycle for her family's riding needs, and K., a staff member of a massage club who requests a loan to purchase a motor to ride to work.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of grocery items

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena A. is from the village of Dolores Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Lucena is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Lucena owns & operates a foodstall in the market. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products like salt, vegetables, coffee, sugar,  etc. in the local community. Lucena is just starting this business.

In 2005, Lucena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos (about US $319) from GDMPC. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lucena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Fidavs

texts.ru: Мирзоев Фирдавс проживает в городе Душанбе.  Женат, детей не имеет. Возраст  26 лет. Фидавс более 4 лет занимается услугой маршрутного такси. У него имеется собственная машина. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы отремонтировать свою машину, т.к. это является единственным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Fidavs M. lives in Dushanbe. He is 26, married, and has no children. Fidavs has been a minibus taxi driver for over 4 years. He owns his own minibus. He is requesting a loan in order to do repairs on the vehicle, as it is his sole source of income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Mtegemee Mola Group

texts.en:
Mboja has sold oil and other items in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She belongs to the Mtegemee Mola group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $25. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more oil and other items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Mboja is 28 years old and married. She has a one-yea-old baby and a 10-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Riziki, who has her own small business selling firewood and soap in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more oil and other items for sale.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila has been a juice and crisps seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to the Nyota njema group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $65. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more fruits, sugar, potatoes and bananas for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for a future use.

Jamila is 29 years old, married and has two children, ages 12 and 9.

loans.use: To buy more fruits, sugar, potatoes and bananas for her business

loans.name: Asarena

texts.en:
Asarena S. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 52 years old. Asarena is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Asarena owns and operates a business venture selling bananas and salted peanuts. Asarena has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month through these activities.

In 2009, Asarena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services with the goal of improving her living situation and increasing her ability to engage in business activities. Asarena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas and peanuts. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Asarena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

texts.en:

To make a living, Memia owns and operates a business venture manufacturing and selling "sawali," or woven bamboo wall products, to local businesses and community members. Memia has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Memia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She became a member to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Memia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw material like bamboo to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Memia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Presentacion

Presentacion A. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 53 years old. Presentacion is married and has three school-aged children. loans.name: Shakeela Nasir Javed Group

texts.en:
Shakeela baji is married to N. J., and they have resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan, for the last fifteen years. Multan city is famous for its shrines. Her husband earns a living by selling clothing in the community. Shakeela baji helps him by selling clothes to their relatives. She is applying for a loan to buy clothes to increase her husband’s  business. 

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Safeera baji and Abida baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Elesia

texts.en:
For five years, Elesia has been the owner of a small grocery for local alcohol sales in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa. She belongs to the Semtema A South group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $100. Every day, she works at her business for six hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She hopes to increase her profit and grow her business through this loan so that she can save money for future use, improve her home, and pay school fees for her youngest children.

Elesia is 45 years old and married, and she has four children, ages 4, 18, 20, and 26. She also cares for three additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more items for the preparation and sale of local alcohol.

loans.name: Mwasafari

texts.en:
Mwasafari has been a cosmetics and bread seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years. She belongs to the Hakuna group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more cosmetics items to add to her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwasafari is 31 years old and married, and she has five children, ages 3, 4, 10, 12, and 15.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics items to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Irshad Javed Masih Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji has been a citizen of Multan, Pakistan for the past ten years. Multan city is famous for its shrines. Her husband’s name is J. M. and he sells embroidered dresses to the clothes shops.

Actually, Irshad baji and her husband both handle their decorative embroidery business. Her husband takes order from the clothes shops and Irshad baji prepares the embroidered dresses. In this way they manage the financial expenses of their house. She is applying for a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and cloth) to complete the order of their customers.

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality: Shahida baji and Agnus baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling businesses.

loans.use: To buy material for her decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Codedia

texts.en:
Codelia is 34 years old and she is married with three children. She sells baby items, such as baby nappies, lotion, and so on.

She hopes to obtain a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more baby items to sell.

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items to sell

loans.name: Parveen Gulzar Group

texts.en:
My name is Parveen and, for the past 14 years, I have belonged to a city named Multan, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines.

My husband’s name is G., and we both handle our decorative-embroidery business. I prepare embroidered dresses and my husband sells them to the clothes shops and earns income. We’ve been in this business for the past three years. The shopkeepers are satisfied with our work. I’m applying for a loan to buy material (colored thread, beads and cloth) to complete the orders and to earn a good income.

I’m the group leader of four other women from my locality:

Mumtaz baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and cloth) for their decorative embroidery business.

Aziza baji and Naseem baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling business.

loans.use: To buy material for her decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina B. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 24 years old. Cristina is married and has three small children. To make a living, Cristina owns and operates a business venture operating a "sari-sari" or general store. She sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Cristina is just starting out in this business.

In 2008, Cristina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari" store. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cristina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Osato

loans.use: To purchase more cows to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita S. is from the village of Bobongan in the municipality of Ramon Magsaysay, which is in Zamboanga del Sur province in the Philippines. She is 60 years-old and married with 11 adult-aged children. To make a living, Juanita owns and operates a business making and selling "sawali," or bamboo woven walls.  She sells her products to local businesses and community members. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

Juanita recently joined GDMPC in hopes of gaining access to financial services that would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita is requesting her first loan from GDMPC in the amount of 5000 PHP so she can purchase additional bamboo to make more products. Juanita plans to use the extra income from growing her business to help pay for her children's education.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To buy more bamboo to make woven bamboo walls to sell.

He buys clothes from the famous bazaar of Multan and sells to the clothes shops and in the community. He has five years of experience in this business.

Shamim baji is a very good human being. She performs her duties as a wife and as a woman efficiently. Her husband is very happy with her. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her husband’s clothes-selling business.

Her husband runs a dairy business. Presently, they have one buffalo at their home. They both get up at 4 o’clock and get milk from the buffalo. Then her husband goes to the milk shops to sell the milk to earn a profit. Naziran baji is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for their dairy business.

loans.name: Seki

texts.en:
For five years, Seki has been selling clothes like khanga and vitende in the Kihesa neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $95. Every day she works at her business for seven hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more khanga and vitenge for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Seki is 40 years old and married. She has two children, ages 18 and 20, but she also cares for seven additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more khanga and vitenge for her business.

loans.name: Eufrasia

texts.en:
Eufrasia M. is 32 years old, married, and has two children, age 10 and 8. She also cares for four dependents. Eufrasia is an animal keeper and has owned a small shop in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for 3 years. She belongs to Dodoma road V west group loan (Group code 2030). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $95. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She hopes that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, save money for future use, improve her home, and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Sitsofe

texts.fr: Sitsofe A. est une femme de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est revendeuses de poissons et des légumes au marché de Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. elle exerce ce commerce depuis 4 ans et désire avec ce crédit accroitre la taille de son activité. Sitsofe compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sitsofe A. is a 41-year-old woman, married, and the mother of three. She is a retailer of fish and vegetables at the marketplace of Womé, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has been in this business for four years and would like to use this loan to expand her business. Sitsofe is counting on this opportunity to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Lip's Group

texts.en:
The five people requesting this small loan are all residents of the province of Battambang. The members have selected Mrs. Lip A., 56, to be the group leader. 

Lip A. sells kitchen materials in the busy local market. She has run this business for years and currently earns approximately $4 each day. Her husband earns a living selling fake jewelry. They have six children, all teenagers and under their care. Lip A.'s business is going very well and gaining much income. To make her business more successful, she is applying for a loan for capital to order additional kitchen materials to sell. 

Four other borrowers have joined this loan as follows:
M. is a used clothe seller. She will use the loan to increase her stock of used clothes to sell.

P. is a used clothes seller, who will expand her business.

P. is a local fruit seller who will buy more kinds of fruits to sell.

T. sells burnable rubber in the market. She will use her loan as capital for her business actions.

loans.use: To order additional kitchen materials to sell.

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan requested by four people, all residents of Battambang Province. The members selected Mrs. Chin U. as group leader. Chin U. is age 59 and is married with only one child, who is married and has already started a new family. Chin U. sells fritters to neighbors in the village. Another source of family income comes from her husband who sells carving wood. He sells wood that he buys from the forest people who live far from his house. Chin U. saw that her husband's business of selling carving wood is very a profitable for their family; thus, she has decided to seek a loan as capital for her husband to purchase more carving wood to sell. 

The other borrowers are:
M. is a cake seller, who is applying for a loan to buy a motor for her husband to run a taxi.

A. is a chef for wedding parties. She applies for a loan for her husband to replace his old motor taxi.

P. sells used clothes and will use her loan to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase carving wood to sell.

loans.name: Sobirchon

texts.ru: Собирчону 29 лет. Женат но детей пока не имеет. У него среднее образование. Собирчон занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Собирчон кредитуется пол года. Когда он пришел в первый раз брать кредит, у него было малое количество скота. Сейчас у Собирчона немного увеличилось количество мелко рогатого скота. У его жены только одна дойная корова. Собирчон планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Sobirchon is 29 years old. He is married, but does not have kids for now. He has a secondary education. Sobirchon fattens and sells livestock and his wife processes and sells milk. Sobirchon has been a borrower for half a year. When he came to take out a loan for the first time he had a small quantity of livestock. Now, Sobirchon has a little more small, horned livestock. His wife has only one dairy cow. Sobirchon plans to purchase one more dairy cow with a calf for his wife and he is grateful to our creditors for their help in bringing his plans to fruition.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: dairy cow

loans.name: Bisokina

texts.ru: Бисокина – женщина 43 лет. Разведенная, имеет 2-х детей. С мужем развелась по личным причинам. Бисокина занимается продажей золотых изделий изделий на рынке Джума-базара и Якшанбе-базара. Золотые изделия она привозит из разных городов зарубежья, в т. ч. из Ташкента, Самарканда, Турции и т. д. Бисокина старается расширить свой бизнес и закупать изделия из Российской Федерации, потому, что там качественные изделия, для расширения своего ассортимента. Этим она хочет увеличить свой семейный доход.
texts.en:
Bisokina is a 43 year old woman. She is divorced and has 2 children. She divorced her husband for personal reasons. Bisokina sells gold jewelry at the markets Djuma-bazaar and Yakshanbe-bazaar. She brings the gold jewelry from different cities abroad such as Tashkent, Samarkand, Turkey, etc. Bisokina tries to grow her business and to purchase jewelry from the Russian Federation because the jewelry there is of high quality in order to grow her product assortment. She would like to increase her family income that way.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of gold jewelry

loans.name: Soeurn's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for four women who live in Battambang Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Soeurn C., age 43, has been selected to be group leader by the other members. 

C. has been selling fruit in the local market for more than four years and earns approximately $3.50 per day. She is married to Bora, 44, who is a construction worker. She is a good mother who has given birth to six children: five are single and one is married and lives separately. 

C. saw that her neighbor's investment selling fresh fish is a profitable one. She hopes to enter this business but she lacks capital, so she would like a loan to use as capital to buy fish to sell. 

The other three borrowers are:
V. provides small loans with specific repayment schedules to the neighborhood. She applies for a loan to use as capital in her business operations.

S. will use the loan to increase her business selling bread.

S. sells Khmer noodles. She requests a loan to begin a new investment as a used clothes seller.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Merbaraka

texts.en:
Merbaraka D. is 46 years old. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housekeeper and Merbaraka's business is their main source of income. Merbaraka has provided transportation services for the last 3 years. Each day on his lorry he transports construction materials for his clients. Merbaraka works hard because he dreams that all his children will be well-educated. As a result the business generates significant income allowing him to support his large family. Currently Merbaraka needs to purchase spare parts to repair his lorry. He believes that this will make his business more profitable. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his lorry.

loans.name: Mansur

texts.ru: Мансур - мужчина средних лет 1960 года. Женат и отец 5-х детей. Мансур занимается откормом и продажей скота на скотном рынке. Он закупает скот и продает через месяца 2-3, если найдется хороший клиент. Или продает через неделю или две недели. Мансур закупает скот дешево по 5-10 голов и продает их в розницу подороже. Таким образом Мансур зарабатывает на жизнь и оборачивает свой капитал. Мансур содержит всю семью. Ему помогают сыновья. Мансур кредитуется в нашей организации более 2-х лет. Он всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ. Мансур благодарен кредитной организации за финансовую помощь.
texts.en:
Born in 1960, Mansur is a middle-aged man, who is married and has 5 children. He is involved in livestock feeding and sales at the livestock market. He buys livestock and sells it 2-3 months later, if a good client is found. Sometimes he resells the livestock a week or two weeks after purchase. Mansur buys livestock at cheap prices, 5-10 heads at a time and resells them retail at higher prices. Mansur supports his whole family. His sons help out with the business. Mansur has been a borrower at our organization over 2 years. He always has clear goals in how he uses his loans. Mansur is grateful to our organization for the financial assistance.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding and sales

loans.name: Gulzamon

texts.en:
Gulzamon is married with 3 children. She sells nice, quality fabrics for national dresses at a big local market. Her husband (pictured) is actively helping her with her business which she started about 10 years ago. Gulzamon would like to ask for a loan of 6800 Somoni to increase her inventory stock which will help supply her until the summer season. She believes this timely investment will help her generate additional income and increase the family budget. IMON International believes Gulzamon’s responsible nature and strong character will assist her in the current loan repayment.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Gulbodom

texts.en:
Gulbodom K. is 27 years-old and married with 2 children. She started her own business 8 years ago because her husband was unemployed at the time.  To earn extra income for her family, Gulbodom sells confectionery like candies, cookies, and pastries at the local market. Gulbodom dreams for all her children to receive higher education. Today she requests 5000 TJS to expand the range of goods that she sells at the market.  Gulbodom will use the extra income from expanding her product selection to improve her family's living situation and pay for her children's education.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more types of confectionery to sell at the market.

loans.name: Bahorgul

texts.en:
Bahorgul K. is a 61-year-old widow raising her two children. Bahorgul is a hard-working woman who has fought hard to provide for her family and educate her children, who today are working adults thanks to her example. Bahorgul has been running her own small business for 15 years already and now her son (pictured) helps with her business. She works from 8am to 5pm at her place in the central local market selling products such as macaroni, soil, sugar, spice, detergent and other items. Now Bahorgul requests a loan in the amount of 5000 TJS so she can purchase more types of items to sell. Bahorgul and her family are sincerely grateful for your support.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a being key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Gulsunoy

texts.ru: Гулсуной молодая девушка 26 лет. Она не замужем.  Гулсуной занимается продажей женской одежды и женского нижнего белья на рынке Сомонбазар г. Худжанда. Она закупает разную женскую одежду, в том числе национальные платья, юбки, сорочки, брюки и т.д. на оптовом рынке города Истаравшан. Гулсуной впервые берет кредит в нашей организации. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес. Гулсуной надеется, что кредит поможет ей расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Gulsunoy is a young, 26-year-old single woman. She is involved in sales of women’s clothing and undergarments at the Somonbazar market in the city of Khujand. She buys different women’s clothing, including traditional dresses, skirts, night gowns, pants, etc. at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. This is Gulsunoy’s first loan at our organization. She wants to expand her business. Gulsunoy hopes that this loan will help her grow her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Lukmanjon

texts.en:
Lukmanjon T. is a 52-year-old married father of 3 children. For 15 years he has been in the business of farming and beekeeping. He started his business when he had difficulty finding employment.  The whole family helps out which has been the key to success for the growth of his business.  He has a steady customer base due to the quality of his products. Lukmanjon is now requesting a loan of 7000 Somoni so he can expand his business and offer better services.  Lukmanjon and his family sincerely thank you for your support.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand his farming and beekeeping business.

loans.name: Suhrobchon

texts.ru: Сухробчон молодой мужчина 1983 года рождения. Женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. У него среднее образование. Сухробчон занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Сухробчон пришел брать кредит в первый раз. У него пока малое количество скота. Сухробчон надеется увеличить количество мелко рогатого скота с помощью кредита. У его жены только одна дойная корова. Сухробчон планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Born in 1983, Suhrobchon is married and has one child. He has a secondary education. Suhrobchon is involved in livestock feeding and sales, and his wife is involved in milk processing and sales. This is Suhrobchon’s first loan request. He currently owns a small quantity of livestock. He hopes to increase his livestock headcount with the help of this loan. His wife owns only one dairy cow. Suhrobchon plans to purchase another dairy cow with a calf for his wife. He is grateful to our creditors for helping him achieve his goals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing livestock headcount

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Маккамова Мархабо –женщина 45-ти лет, замужем , имеет 3-х детей. Её муж уехал в Россию работать. Здесь он не смог найти хорошую работу, чтобы накопить денег и купить для себя скот. У Мархабо было всего лишь 4 барана. Но недавно она узнала о кредитовании нашей организации, и пришла брать кредит для покупки одной дойной коровы. Она будет доить молоко и давать детям. Если останется она будет продавать. Пока ее муж найдет работу в России и пришлет ей деньги, ей будет помогать ее брат.
texts.en:
Marhabo M. is a 45 year old woman, she is married and has three children. Her husband went to Russia to work. He could not find a good job here to save money and buy himself cattle. Marhabo has only four sheep. But she has recently found out about loans and our organization and decided to take out a loan to buy another milk cow. She will milk the cow and give the milk to her children. She will sell the remainders. Until her husband can find work in Russia and start sending money her brother will be helping Marhabo.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Omoyemwen

texts.en: Omoyemwen is 25 years-old and married with one child.  To earn income for her family, Omoyemwen sells cosmetics in retail to her customers.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell.  She would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Ugul

texts.en:
Ugul A. is a lovely 43-year-old divorced mother raising two children. She runs a small business at the local market, selling many types of fabrics for different tastes and ages. Ugul is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of goods and expand her merchandise selection.  She believes this will improve her business and increase her profits. Her dreams are to have her own large store one day, but most importantly, to enable her children to have a better future - one where they can continue to study at the university, become professionals, and lead healthy and comfortable lives. On behalf of Ugul and everyone here at IMON International, thank you for your support!

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new fabrics for her market shop.

loans.name: Guzal

texts.ru: Рахимова Гузал- молодая женщина 38-ми лет,замужем, имеет троих детей.Занимается купля-продажей скота . Её муж Искандаров Абдурашид  покупает скот на скотных рынках кишлаков и сёл по низким ценам. Гузал  откармливает купленный скот дома в течении недели и продает на скотном рынке Спитаменского района. Кроме этого она и её муж работают в колхозе. Там они имеют небольшой земельный участок и выращивают овощи и пшеницу. Гузал и её муж рады, что кредитуются у нас и намерены продолжить сотрудничество с нашей организацией.
texts.en:
R. Guzal is a young 38 year old woman; she is married and has three children. She purchases and sells livestock. Her husband, Iskandrov Abdurashid, purchases livestock at livestock markets in villages at low prices. Guzal fattens the purchased livestock at home during the week and sells it at the livestock market in the Spitamen region. In addition, she and her husband work at a collective farm. There they have a small plot of land and grow vegetables and wheat. Guzal and her husband are happy that they are our borrowers and are determined to continue their partnership with our organization.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Musharraf

texts.en:
Musharraf R. is forty-six years old and married with three children. She has been running her own small business for six years. She rents a store in the local market where she sells groceries. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. Musharraf is very friendly and polite which attracts customers. She is requesting a loan for purchasing a wider range of goods for her store. This will help her to provide for her children's needs and to pay their school fees. Musharraf promises to repay her loan without any delay and thanks everyone who decides to support her. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of goods to well

loans.name: Turdijon

texts.ru: Джумаева Турдижон-женщина 58-ми лет, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Занимается продажей детской одежды на вещевом рынке Спитаменсского района. Вместе со своей дочерью Дилрабо она два раза в месяц ездит за товаром  в город Истаравшан. Так как сейчес сезон летней одежды, Турдижон решила расширить свой ассортимент за счет полученного кредита. Её товары пользуются хорошим спросом. Турдижон благодрна наший огранизации за оказанную ей помощь в расширении её бизнеса.
texts.en:
Turdijon D. is 58 years old, married and has 3 children. She is involved in sales of children’s clothing at a clothing market in the Spitamen district. Together with her daughter Dilrabo, she travels to the city of Istaravshan for her merchandise. Since now is the season for summer clothing, Turdijon decided to expand her goods assortment using this loan. Her merchandise is in good demand. Turdijon is grateful to our organization for supporting her business expansion.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Linus

texts.en: Linus is thirty-four years old and married with five children. He sells VCDs (video compact discs) to make a living. He hopes for a loan to purchase more VCDs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new summer clothing for women.

loans.name: Aerkinjin

texts.ru: Турсунов Эркинжин-молодой человек 26-ти лет,женат, детей пока не имеет. Эркинжон- старший сын в семье и поэтому, чтобы помочь своим родителям решил заняться откормом и купля-продажей скота.Он имеет опыт в сфере животновдства, так  как помогал своему отцу откармливать крупно-рогатый скот. На полученный кредит он расчитывает купить дойную корову, чтобы иметь дополнительный доход для своей семьи.Кроме того он работает колхозником в колхозе «Гулистон».
texts.en:
Aerkinjin T. is a young 26-year old man, who is married and does not yet have children. Because he is the oldest son in his family, he decided to become involved in livestock feeding and sales to help his parents. Aerkinjin has experience in the animal husbandry field because he used to help his father feed cattle. Besides this business, he works as a farmer at the Guliston collective farm. Aerkinjin plans to use this loan to purchase a dairy cow in order to have additional income for his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena G. is married with two daughters. She sells headgear in the central market of Novomoskovsk. A wide assortment of the latest items attracts many customers to her vending location. She has enjoyed stable sales for the past ten years. Currently, her profit is approximately $465 a month. 

Yelena is hoping to continue developing her business and providing for her family. She is planning to use the loan to purchase additional merchandise and to expand the assortment of inventory for sale. She loves working with this type of merchandise and is ready to put more effort into its further growth and expansion.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is forty-eight years old and married with seven children. He is a commercial bus driver. However, he is in need of a loan to purchase a new engine for his bus to replace the old one that went bad during the last rainy season. A new bus engine will enable him to continue to make a living from commercial driving. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a new bus engine

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero is 46 years-old and married with 7 children.  To make a living, Vero sells beef.  She has been in this business for a long time.  Vero is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more beef to sell.  She would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Ахмедова Гульбахор- женщина 56-ти лет, замужем, имеет 4-х детей.Чтобы прокормить свою семью она вместе со своим мужем  занимается откормом и купля-продажей скота.Живет она в селе где нет работы. Основной источник дохода это выращивание сельской хозяйственной  культуры и  Переводы с России. Ее старший сын присылает ей немного денег, но теперь из-за кризиса он последние 2 месяца не присылал денег.  
Она продала быка и  планировала купить дойную корову. Но корова стоит дороже и для этого она обратилась за кредитом в Микроинвест. Узнала об условиях кредита. После получения кредита купила корову. Теперь у нее есть несколько дойных коров.  Она благодарна КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulbahor A. is 56 years old, married and has 4 children. Together with her husband, she is involved in livestock feeding and sales in order to support their family. She lives in a village where there is no work. The main source of income is agriculture and money transfers from Russia. Her oldest son sends some money home, but because of the economic crisis, he has not sent any money last two months. Gulbahor sold a bull and planned to buy a dairy cow. However, because the cow costs more than she expected, Gulbahor requested a loan from MicroInvest. She learned about the lending terms and purchased a cow after receiving her loan. Now she owns several dairy cows. Gulbahor is grateful to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of cattle

loans.name: Iulia

texts.en: Iulia is potentially going to take a position as a farmer but she wants to begin producing something to take advantage of available tax deductions.  There are approximately 70 cows on this farm that produce milk. The farm has some fencing but not much.  She already owns a significant amount of equipment like tractors, planters, tillage equipment, and mowers. Iulia is requesting a loan from Microinvest to purchase additional fencing needed for the farm, which will also allow her to take advantage of the tax deductions.

loans.use: To build fencing on the farm.

loans.name: Zirahon

texts.ru: Набиева Зирахон-1965 года рождения, замужем,  имеет 3-х детей . Её муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию, чтобы там зарабатывать деньги, как и многие рабочие мигранты, которые не могут найти здесь нормальную работу. Зирахон  занимается продажей мелких товаров ,таких как хозяйственные товары, электроприборы и т . д. Её торговая точка расположена  на Центральном рынке Спитаменского района и поэтому торговля у нее идет хорошо. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и открыть еще одну точку продажи.
texts.en:
Born in 1965, Zirahon N. is married and has 3 children. Her husband went to Russia to earn money, just like many migrant workers, who could not find work here at home. Zirahon is involved in sales of small goods, such as household products, electric appliances, etc. Because her retail outlet is located at the Central market of the Spitamen district, her sales are going well. Zirahon wants to expand her business and open one more retail store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open another store

loans.name: Rec Infant-Hastings Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the R.E.C. Primary School for Infants in Hastings requesting a group loan. The school was founded by the government to give pre-school education to the children of the Hastings community. There are currently 596 pupils and 13 staff.  Like many schools in Sierra Leone, R.E.C. Primary School for Infants lacks adequate classrooms, seating, and learning and teaching materials.

This will be the first loan for the teachers from SMT/Kiva. Because government salaries for teachers are usually very small, the SMT/Kiva loans are very much helpful to these teachers. With these loans, some of the teachers will invest in a side business to supplement their teaching salaries.  Others will use it to buy pieces of furniture like a bed or chairs, buy a piece of land on which to build a house, or purchase building materials.  Others will use the loan to pay for college fees to pursue further studies, or school fees for their children.  Gradually, with their monthly salaries, these teachers will repay their loans.

Gifty M. N. (fifth from right) is the deputy head teacher of the R.E.C. Primary School for Infants. She was born in Hastings, about twenty-three miles from Freetown, which is the capital city of Sierra Leone.  She is single with four children.  One of her children is already an adult, two are in secondary school, and one is still in primary school.  She has been a teacher for 31 years now.  Gifty will use this loan to buy home building materials – bundles of corrugated iron roofing, bags of cement, and sand.  This loan alone can not build her a house, but combined with her savings and subsequent loans she hopes to get from SMT/Kiva, she believes she will be able to build herself the house she so desires.  With a house, she will no longer be paying rent and will be a very happy woman together with her family.

loans.use: To buy home building materials.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is the mother of two children and she does everything possible to care for them. She has a rented boutique in Ungheni town and has been in business for many years. She must always be forward, progressive, and intelligent to compete with such big shops around her.

Natalia sells only a few edition sports products, having shifted to focus on this extremely successful fashion retail. With an eye for high-end sportswear and casual trends exemplified by brands like Lacoste, Addidas, Reebok, and Nike, she would like to enlarge her stock of goods.

Microinvest granted her a loan to buy clothes for summer as warmer weather approaches.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of sportswear.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Акрамова Шоира – женщина 36-ти лет, замужем имеет 3-х детей. Более 5-лет она вместе со своим мужем  занимается производством и продажей шашлыка и других национальных блюд. Её торговая точка расположена  у входа на Вещевой рынок Спитаменского района и поэтому торговля у нее идет хорошо. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и открыть еще одну точку продажи в центре района.  Этим она хочет увеличить свой семейный доход. Шоира благодарна нашим партнёрам по КИВЕ за оказанную ей подержку в развитии её бизнеса.
texts.en:
Shoira A. is 36 years old, married and has 3 children. Together with her husband, she is involved in making and selling kabobs and other traditional dishes. They have been in this business over 5 years. Because Shoira’s retail outlet is located at the entrance of the clothing market in the Spitamen district, her sales are high. She wants to expand her business and open one more retail outlet in the district center. This will increase her family income. Shoira is grateful to our partners at Kiva for supporting her business development.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Opening another store

loans.name: Aelerjon

texts.ru: Эргашев Элёржон-молодой человек1985 года рождения ,женат имеет 2 детей ,жена  Холбоева Шахноза .Клиент берёт кредит  для расширения  своего бизнеса . Элёржон  занимается купля продажей и откормом  скота .Ему в этом помогает отец . Дополнительно Элёржон  занимается  выращиванием и переработкой сельхозпродуктов , чтобы пополнить свой семейный бюджет.На полученный кредит он расчитывает купить 2-х  бычков, откормив их в течении3-4 месяцев, продаст их за хорошую цену.
texts.en:
Born in 1985, Aelerjon A. is married and has 2 children. His wife is Shahnoza Kholboeva. He requested this loan for business expansion. Aelerjon is involved in livestock feeding and sales. His father helps him with this business. In addition, Aelerjon is involved in growing and processing of agricultural products in order to subsidize his family budget. He plans to use this loan to purchase two bulls, feed them for 3-4 months and then resell them at a good price.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde T. is 30 years old and married with three children. She sells cosmetics, clothes, and footwear by hawking her goods within her community in Benin City in Edo State, Nigeria.

She hopes for a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more cosmetics and footwear. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei has a business selling footwear in Balti town. He has opened three boutiques in the central market of the town. Over the years, big-name stores have settled in his territory, but Alexei’s focus on quality from the inside out has helped him not only stand his ground but also benefit from the extra foot traffic. He provides extensive training to his three employees on everything about new products. He also keeps careful track of key measurables, like sales, and sets high goals. He has since opened three more locations in Chisinau City, carefully choosing high-traffic places that attract a variety of consumers.

He requested a loan from Microinvest to increase his stock of goods over at least for the next two years.

loans.use: To increase his stock of footwear, for at least for the next two years.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Абдукаюмова Саломат-женщина 28-ми лет,замужем , имеет двоих детей. Занимается продажей муки на продовольственном рынке Спитаменского района. Один  раз в месяц она закупает муку у оптовиков и продаёт на рынке по розничной цене. Раньше у неё хватало денег только на 10-12 мешков муки, теперь расширив свой товарооборот она закупает около 100 мешков муки.Кроме этого Саломат работает в школе, преподаёт родной язык  в одной из сельских школ. Пока она на работе  на рынке торгует её муж. Они с мужем рады ,что обратившись в нашу организацию, получили возможность расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Salomat A. is 28 years old, married and has two children. She is involved in selling flour at a food market in the Spitamen district. She buys flour wholesale once per month and sells it retail at the market. Before, she could afford to buy only 10-12 bags of flour, and now, after increasing her product turnover, she buys close to 100 bags of flour. Besides this business, Salomat teaches Tajik language at one of the village schools. While she works at the school, her husband sells at the market. Salomat and her husband are happy that they requested a loan from our organization and were able to expand their business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Rose Plus Group

texts.fr: Godefroid K. vend des produits divers tels que du savon, des boites à conserves, du sucre, de l’huile végétale, des fournitures scolaires etc… à Kingasani qui se situe au nord de la ville et la partie la plus peuplée de Kinshasa. Il a commencé le commerce par vendre la boisson sucrée en 2001 avec un capital initial de $20. De 2001 – 2005, l’activité a prospéré et lui a permis d’ouvrir une petite boutique générale. Par un travail déterminant et des bénéfices accumulés, Godefroid est parvenu à réunir cette année un capital propre de $250. Il compte acheter avec le crédit du mois de mai courant des articles pour renforcer le stock de sa marchandise afin de satisfaire le besoin de ses clients en sucrés et sucettes. Il rencontre quelques difficultés dues aux coupures intempestives de l’électricité. Mais il utilise les blocs de glace pour refroidir la boisson tel que souhaité par sa clientèle. Actuellement, son affaire produit $144 de bénéfice par mois. Il espère faire plus que cela dans un proche avenir car son ambition est d’ouvrir une chambre froide pour stocker des vivres frais pour des clients dans le but d’accroitre le revenu. Godefroid est membre fidèle de l’un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « La Rose » depuis 2008. Il est âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 2 et 12 ans. Deux d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Godefroid K. sells various goods, such as soap, canned foods, sugar, vegetable oil, school supplies, etc... in Kingasani, which is located on the north side of the city of Kinshasa and its most populated part. He started the business by selling sweet beverages in 2001 with $20 in initial capital. From 2001-2005, it was prosperous, enabling him to open a small general store. Through decisive effort and accumulated profits, he was able to amass $250 of working capital this year. Godefroid intends to use the loan of this May to buy merchandise to bolster his inventory in order to satisfy the needs of his customers for sugar and lollipops. He's running into difficulties due to electric power outages occurring at awkward moments. But he uses blocks of ice to cool his drinks just the way his customers like it. Currently, his business produces $144 in profits a month. He hopes to make more than that in the near future because his ambition is to open a cold room to store fresh foodstuff for customers with the goal of growing his revenues. Godefroid has been a member of a HOPE RDC group named "La Rose" since 2008. He is 42 years old, married, and the father of four children, ranging in age from 2 to 12. Two of them go to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To diversify his business by adding lollipops, which are sold a lot, to increase his profits

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en:
Funmilayo F. sells clothes and cosmetics. She is 38 years old and married with three children.

She hopes for a loan in the amount of N30,000 to purchase more clothes and cosmetics to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Khursanoy

texts.ru: Абдурасулова Хурсаной-молодая женщина 39-ти лет, замужем , имеет двоих детей.Хурсаной занимается изготовлением и продажей национальных блюд. Они с мужем имеют маленькую столовую на территории Центрального рынка Спитаменского района.Она начинала с продажи пирожков и бутербродов, постепенно расширив свой бизнес она увеличила ассортимент блюд. Сейчас у Хурсаной много постоянных клиентов.Это продавцы и посетители рынка .Хурсаной вместе со своим мужем мечтает открыть собственный ресторан в центре района.
texts.en:
Khursanoy A. is 39 years old, married and has two children. She is involved in preparing and selling traditional dishes. Together with her husband, Khursanoy owns a small café at the Central market in the Spitamen district. She started with selling pies and sandwiches, then gradually expanded her business and increased the assortment of dishes. Now Khursanoy has many loyal clients, among which are other sellers and market visitors. Khursanoy and her husband dream of opening their own restaurant at the district center.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Mason

texts.en:
Mason E. is 28 years old and single. He is a mechanic who also sells spare auto parts.

He hopes for a loan in the amount of N80,000 to purchase more parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more spare auto parts to sell.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: Mary T. (pictured bottom right), age 56, is a determined and hardworking woman with a salon business that she has just started in Ibanda town.  She has been, and still is, a farmer but wanted something that could bring in a daily income because the farm produce takes a long time to mature. Mary is married with 6 children ages 17-35 years-old.  Only 3 children are still in school, one in secondary school and two at the University. She believes that her salon will do well because it has a good location and thanks to the loyalty of her customers who already come to her home for salon services, but now she will take them to the salon. She dreams of building a first-class salon as well as having the rest of her children attain the best of education. She is requesting a loan to buy a hair dryer and hair products for her salon.  Mary is the group leader of Mary T.'s Group which has 11 other members.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and hair products for her new salon.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary I. is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions. She is 36 years-old and married with 3 children.  Mary is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 which she will use to purchase more hair extensions to sell.  She wants to say thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
In Ukraine many people prefer shopping in the market. Irina is one of the market vendors who serve these clients. After trying out a couple of other business ventures, she found that she liked selling retail items the most. She credits her success to finding a good market opportunity and to receiving timely financial assistance from “Nadiya Ukraine.”  Her integrity and hard-working attitude have allowed her to establish her business and keep it stable.  Presently, Irina earns about 8,000 Grivnyas each month. 

After 15 years in business, Irina is requesting a loan of 15,000 Gryvnias in order to stock her retail space with new inventory, which she will be able to purchase in bulk. Irina and her husband Andrei are the proud parents of two daughters. Her desire is to increase her productivity and raise her net income so that she can continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: To increase merchandise inventory.

loans.name: Kyeviiri's Group

texts.en: Kyeviiri N. is a very hardworking mother of six children, two of whom are still in school. She also helps care for four grandchildren. She has been selling produce in Ibanda town for over fifteen years. She gets some of the produce from her own garden and the rest from her fellow farmers who have no access to a ready market. The previous loans she has gotten have helped her with paying her children’s school fees, and this is why she has been able to send her eldest four through school while she continues to take on the rest of her responsibilities. She needs a loan to help with paying school fees for her school-going children as well as for employing labor on her farm.

loans.use: To employ labor on her farm and pay school fees

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce B. is thirty-nine years old and married with four children. She sells provisions and drinks. She hopes for a loan to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is thirty-three years old and married with four children. She sells secondhand clothes. She hopes for a loan to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is married. She lives in Belaya Tserkov and sells groceries and pastry in the city market called “Bilotserkivets”. Her merchandise always sells well because of the lower price policy Svitlana has set in her kiosk. She is a hard worker and usually works late hours after all other market vendors are done with their sales for the day. Svitlana has been in the trade for five years. Currently, her turnover capital is about $2000. Gross income is about $1450 a month, while monthly net profit is usually about $750. 

Svitlana would like to get a loan to buy assorted inventory for her vending location. She is hoping to generate additional profit to provide for the needs of her family and to help her younger daughter (pictured) through college.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en: Andrei has been selling perfume oils for over five years. This has been a very successful business.  When Andrei originally intended to start his business he was skeptical because he did not have enough money to launch the business. He had just closed a lucrative soap shop temporarily to move to a new location. After finally signing the lease, not even two weeks before he was to open, the owners of the property told him that he could not sell jewelry there because his shop would be competing with a major new store that was opening soon. Andrei had two choices. He could either back out of the lease or continue with the lease with a different product mix. This was a very viable location and he did not want to let it go. Over the coming days Andrei had to come up with an idea that he could feel comfortable with in order to move forward. He already had the oils because he carried them in his soap shop, so he decided to renegotiate the lease for a small fragrance shop instead. He knows that this would turn out to be one of the best decisions of his life. Andrei borrowed from the Kiva partner, Microinvest, to pay for the original rental of the shop. Andrei is sure that he will succeed in his business and will return the loan in time to Microinvest.

loans.use: To pay rent on the shop

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy sells fruits like pineapples. She also sells roasted beef. 

She is 32 years old and married with two children. 

She hopes for a loan in the amount of N140,000 (US$975) to purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Philo

texts.en:
Philo sells foodstuffs like garri, made from cassava tubers. 

She is 25 years old and married with three children. 

She hopes for a loan of N100,000 (US$700) to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace T. is a 40-year-old determined and hard-working lady with a business of selling shoes at various daily markets for three years now. I say determined because ever since she divorced her husband, life has not been easy, but she has vowed to make it a point that her children do not lack anything.

She started up this business using the little money she had saved. After starting up, she applied for a loan from Pearl Microfinance and received it. Right now, she is able to make profits of 140,000 shillings per month and life is a bit better. She is a mother of five children ages 5 to 20 years in secondary and primary school, and she has a goal of having a healthy family that is also well educated. She currently needs her fourth loan to help with restocking her business with more shoes.

loans.use: Buying more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Eghosa

texts.en:
Eghosa is 40 years old and married with two children. She sells crates of drinks in wholesale and retail. 

She hopes for a loan of N120,000 (US$825) to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy I. sells medicines in retail to her customers. She is 36 years old and married with two children. 

She hopes for a loan of N50,000 (US$350) to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia tiene 40 años, madre de 4 hijos, mujer muy trabajadora que vive en su casa propia junto  a dos de sus hijas; Yulisa de 15 años y Jerson de 11 que son el motivo de su sacrificio y trabajo. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a venta de ropa, tales como; chompas y buzos de lana, los jueves y domingos en las ferias de la ciudad de Tarma, su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Huancayo donde la encuentra a un precio muy cómodo, que le permite acumular mayores ganancias. Por otra parte, el resto de los días, trabaja en su chacra, ya que le agrada mucho esta labor, y para lograr buenas cosechas, cada temporada abona sus cultivos, para eso alquila un burro donde  transporta los sacos de fertilizantes hasta su chacra, y después de abonar sus sembríos se concentra en alimentar bien al burro hasta que quede satisfecho, y de ese modo se lo vuelvan a alquilar posteriormente. Durante estos años de trabajo como agricultora y comerciante Dionisia aprendió a cuidar a sus plantas y a sus clientes, puesto que sabe que gracias a ellos tendrá el dinero necesario para mantener a sus hijos y brindarles educación, y de ese modo mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, en sus anteriores créditos ha sido muy puntual y espera seguir del mismo modo en este ciclo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy graciosa y todos los integrantes le tienen mucho cariño. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de insecticidas para sus cultivos, y con otro tanto incrementará la cantidad de mercadería en prendas de ropa gruesa para el invierno.
texts.en:
Dionisia is 40 years old, the mother of four children, and a very hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with two of her daughters--Yulisa, 15, and Jerson, 11, who motivate her sacrifice and work. For the past five years, she has worked selling clothing like wool sweaters on Thursdays and Sundays in the fairs of Tarma city. She buys her merchandise in the city of Huancayo, where she can buy at a convenient price, which permits her to earn better profits. On the other days of the week, she works in her field. She enjoys this work a great deal. In order to reap a good harvest, she fertilizes her crops every season, and she uses a donkey to transport the fertilizers to her field. After fertilizing her seeds, she feeds the donkey until it is satisfied and thus prepares it to work again. During these years of working as a farmer and saleswoman, Dionisia has learned to take care of her plants as well as her customers. She knows that thanks to them, she will have enough money to take care of her children and give them an education, and thus improve their quality of life. This is her third loan with MFP. In her previous loans, she was very punctual and she hopes to continue this in the current loan cycle. She is very gracious in her communal bank and all the members care for her deeply. With this loan, she will purchase insecticides for her crops, and she will use the rest of the funds to increase the quantity of thick winter clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase insecticides and increase merchandise for sale

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia loves flowers and has innate artistic ability in creating wonderful floral arrangements, so she wants to start a florist shop business. Flowers are a big part of people’s lives. Their beauty and color allows us to convey our messages perfectly: get-well soon for our sick friends and family, congratulatory messages to a newly promoted colleague, condolences to a grieving family, and to express our love to another person. Every occasion is celebrated with flowers. 

Silvia has experience in the business from working in another floral shop before. 
The materials that she will need for florist services include: a store or sales location, a refrigeration system, flowers, plants, floral supplies and secondary products she wants to sell.  

At the start, she decided to run her florist business from home, doing the entire process of designing, selling, delivering and ordering new supplies.  

Silvia has requested a loan from Microinvest to start a florist shop business.

loans.use: Starting a florist shop

loans.name: Christ Roi Plus Group

texts.fr: Evelyne A. a comme activité commerciale, une terrasse. Elle a commencé à exercer le commerce depuis 1994 en vendant 4 futs d’huile de palme qui lui ont procuré un capital propre de $700 en 1997.  En 1998, elle tentât de vendre des habits usagers qu’elle abandonna la même année suite à l’échec. Elle se décida ainsi de se lancer jusqu’aujourd’hui dans la vente des boissons. Comme ses clients ne cessent de croitre et dans le souci d’accroitre le revenu, Evelyne a planifié d’acheter avec le crédit de mois de mai courant, 9 casiers de boissons sucrées pour satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle. Actuellement, son capital propre est de $150 et son activité lui procure un bénéfice de $60 par semaine. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un dépôt des boissons. Elle est devenue membre fidèle de l’un des groupes de Hope depuis décembre 2008. Evelyne est mariée et mère de 7 enfants âgés entre de 7 à 23 ans dont tous étudient.
texts.en:
Evelyne A. has a terrasse as her business. She started this business in 1994 by selling four drums of palm oil that gained her $700 in capital in 1997. In 1998, she tried selling second-hand clothing but abandoned that business the same year following its failure. She then decided to get started in the sale of beverages and does so today. Since her customers are ever-growing in number, and having concerns about increasing her revenues, Evelyne has planned to use the loan of this May to buy nine cases of sweet beverages to satisfy her customers. Currently, her capital is at $150, and her business brings in a profit of $60 per week. Her ambition is to open a beverages outlet. She has become a loyal member of a HOPE group since December 2008. Evelyne is married and the mother of seven children, ranging in age from 7 to 23 years, who are all students.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nine cases of sweet drinks to resell in order to grow her revenues

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es: Jovita tiene 40 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, que es el padre de sus 4 hijos, de los cuales, los 2 últimos aún están estudiando en la escuela de su pueblo. Junto a su esposo trabajan como jornaleros en las chacras de sus vecinos, y en menor cantidad,  siembran sus propios cultivos como; papa, arvejas y ullucos. Por ello se ve en la obligación de madrugar para tener tiempo de preparar los alimentos; y estar a las 8.00am en su trabajo habitual, donde le pagan 12 soles diarios a ella, y a su esposo 15 soles, de ese modo cubren la alimentación de sus hijos. Los cultivos de sus chacras los realizan, sólo las veces que se desocupan, ya que sus cosechas son cada 6 ú 8 meses, mientras tanto, trabajar arduamente donde los contraten. Pero ahora, esta pareja se ha propuesto darle un giro a su vida, quieren avocarse más a sus cultivos y lograr que produzcan en mayor cantidad y den frutos de primera calidad, los que puedan enviar a los diversos mercados de la zona y con esas ganancias comprar sus propios terrenos de cultivo.
