loans.name: Simon Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Simón V. tiene 46 años de edad, habitante del barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, vive con su compañera de vida que es ama de casa, tiene tres hijos y todos trabajan.Los planes a largo plazo es construir su vivienda.Don Simón su principal actividad económica es la venta de leña y matanza de chancho con 15 años de experiencia en el destace de cerdos. Iniciando su negocio con fondos propios negocio requiere de mayores ingresos para ser reinvertidos ya que se necesita un vehiculo en el cual se pueda expandirse la venta de leña.El préstamo que solicita en Afodenic es para la compra de materia prima como: mayores cantidades de leña, cerdos, iniciar la venta de gas y de otros productos.

loans.use: Comaprar leña, cerdos y gas butano

loans.name: William

texts.es: William tiene 38 años, vive con su esposa y sus 7 hijos en su propia casa de su pueblo natal. Nació en una familia de agricultores, y desde los 18 años decidió dedicarse a la agricultura de manera independiente, y ahora con esta actividad, sostiene la economía de su propia familia. Sus hijos y su esposa son un apoyo constante en las tareas físicas que requiere para el cuidado de sus plantas. Y aunque estas tareas suelen ser muy agotadoras, William considera que es su forma de vida, y sus hijos también están aprendiendo el mismo valor de la herencia que les está dejando su padre. Para el futuro, William quiere producir mayor cantidad de papas, para poder venderlas en otros mercados más rentables que el de su localidad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y a su vez, su primera experiencia en un banco comunal, y tiene de por medio, su compromiso de trabajar responsablemente por la unidad de su grupo. El dinero que solicita será utilizando para la compra de abono, semillas de papa y pesticidas.
texts.en:
William is 38 years old. He lives with his wife and their 7 children in their own home in the town of his birth. He was born into a family of farmers and for the past 18 years he has worked in agriculture independently, an activity he uses to support his family. His children and wife are constant supports in the physical tasks that are necessary for the care of his crops. Although these tasks are often very exhausting, this is William's way of life, and his children are now learning the value of this legacy. In the future, William wants to grow more potatoes in order to sell them in other markets which are more profitable than the one in his area. This is his first loan with MFP, and his first experience in a communal bank. He has committed to working responsibly for the unity of his group. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase fertilizer, potato seeds and pesticides.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Señoras Del Sur Group

texts.es:
En la zona de villa Exaltación esta ubicado el centro focal que lleva el mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Señoras del Sur”, esta  formado  por diez  miembros y trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace mas de tres años.
La elaboración y venta de comida es la actividad principal de este grupo, algunas  tienen pensiones otras venden en puestos  fijos en las calles y también a pedido. Desean ampliar sus ventas, por lo que necesitan abastecerse de mayores insumos para la elaboración de sus variados platillos. Todas las ganancias que generen serán invertidas en la educación de sus hijos, afirman.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Vila Exaltación there is a community center with the same name. The "Señoras del Sur" (Women of the South) association is a part of it. It is made up of 10 members and they have worked with Pro-Mujer for more than 3 years. This group's main activity is the preparation of meals. Some have established customers; others work at street stands or with custom orders. They would like to increase their sales, so they need to purchase more ingredients for the various meals they prepare. They promise that all of the profits that they generate will be used for the education of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Nueva Maranatha Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Nueva Maranatha”, esta formada por doce socias que trabajan en el centro focal Juan Pablo II ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto. Con la ayuda de su asesor de creditos realizan sus actividades de manera responsable y puntual.
Ellas tienen negocios individuales podemos mencionar algunas actividades, tienda de repuestos; tienda de abarrotes, taller radiotécnico, venta de muebles, elaboración y venta de refrescos, venta de papa, venta de carne de pollo, tiendas de barrio.
Afirman que las ventas bajaron y sus ganancias no son suficientes para mantener económicamente a sus familias, por lo que necesitan de mayor capital para reforzar sus negocios, adquiriendo mercadería, están seguros que generaran mejores ingresos para el bien de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Maranatha" association is made up of 12 members who work at the Juan Pablo II center located in the city of El Alto. With the help of their loan advisor they undertake their activities responsibly and punctually. Each woman has her own business, some of the activities are: parts store, general store, radio repair shop, furniture sales, preparation and sale of refreshments, potato sales, meat and chicken sales, neighborhood stores. They state that sales have declined and their profits are not sufficient to support their families, so they need more capital to strengthen their businesses by acquiring more merchandise. They are confident they will generate better income for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Unidas Para Crecer, Group 2

texts.en:
Rafaela Z. is the group coordinator for these five entrepreneurs. She and her friends will be taking their second loan with Esperanza International. Their first was a great help in setting up their businesses and they hope that with these second loans they can expand both their sales and their profits.

Rafaela has three children ages 7, 9 and 12. She sells jewelry which she buys, most of the time, at the commercial district in Santo Domingo, the capital city. She will use this loan to buy a large inventory, expecting her jewelry sales to pick up with Mother's Day coming up on May 31st.

Rafaela has not always sold clothes. She once had a chemical products manufacturing business. She used to make cleaning products and personal care products like shampoo and soap. Rafaela hopes to invest her jewelry profits into setting up her chemical factory again. She would like to be admired in her community as a hard-working woman full of creativity and always looking to grow as a person.

Pleas help us support this group with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase jewelry for resale

loans.name: Unidas Para Crecer, Group 1

texts.en:
These five entrepreneurs are receiving their 6th loan from Esperanza International. They have had a good payment history so far, and they have used their loans wisely by reinvesting in their businesses to expand their sales.

Gladys C. is the group coordinator. She did not finish high school. She and her husband have two children ages 14 and 10 who attend school.

Gladys sells clothes, both in her neighborhood, to her acquaintances, and in the San Pedro market on market days. She will use her loan to buy new clothes to sell. She expects women's clothing to sell a bit more this month because of Mother's Day. She wants to have a couple of special items for her clients who might be looking for a special piece to either wear or give.

Gladys expects to increase her profits and hopes to stop being an informal vendor one day. Her dream is to have a boutique where she can offer her merchandise, in order to continue improving her family's life quality.

On behalf of Gladys and her friends, thank you for supporting this Kiva loan!

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
The smiling face in the picture is Mrs. Suon S., 45, a widow and the mother of two single children. One of her children works as an employee for a house business.

Presently, Suon S. earns a living as a local fish catcher. She relies on fishing in and around Tunle Sap Lake that is the main place that fish shelter. She will be using the loan to purchase extra nets and traps in order to catch fish.

loans.use: To purchase extra nets and traps

loans.name: La Alianza, Group 4

texts.en:
The five entrepreneurs taking part in this loan are on their 6th loan cycle with Esperanza International. Ysabel S. is their coordinator.

Ysabel and her husband have three children, but they are all grown up. Ysabel has hairstyling skills, but doesn't work as a hairdresser. Instead, she sells a variety of products: from accesories, to personal care, to home products. She will use this loan to buy what her customers have been ordering from her lately.

Ysabel doesn't want to go back to beauty. She dreams of becoming an important supplier in the San Pedro area and own a large warehouse. She also hopes her profits will help her support her children's education and help them go to college.

Ysabel has come a long way, but has not lost her determination or initiative. Please help us continue to support her and her friends with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchasing varied merchandises to sell

loans.name: But

texts.en: But S. started her business a long time ago. She is a grocery seller. She is 39 years old and a mother of three children, all three of whom are single and assist her in the business when they are not studying. She currently sells her items, such as cooking ingredients and sweets for kids, to the villagers. Another income source comes from her husband who works as a military policeman. The family has been building their house for a long time but due to the family's financial problems the construction is still not completed. Therefore, But S. requested a loan of $500 in order to finish building their house.

loans.use: To finish building their house

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Vending of cooked foods, native cakes and vegetables is the chosen business of Lolita.  Her request of PHP 6,000.00 would be of great help for the growth of her small enterprise.  She sells her merchandise in their village in Sta. Ana, Echague, Isabela. 

Lolita has seven children, five of them are married and two are still studying: Elizabeth - 15 years old, fourth year high school and Frederick - 12 years old, grade school. She hopes that she may be able to support the education of their children and for them to become successful.

loans.use: Business growth

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina lives in the village of Sta. Ana Echague, Isabela. She is 48 years old and married to Lorenzo Sr. The couple has six children: Darwin, 27 years old, and Efren, 26 years old, are both college undergraduates; George, 25 years old, is a vocational course graduate who is now working in Saudi Arabia; Lorenzo Jr. is 22 years old and a college graduate; Lorena is 20 years old and also a college graduate; and Kerovin is 16 years old and a high school senior student.

Rufina is engaged in selling ready-to-wear (RTW) in her village. She buys different clothes and then sells them afterwards. She now wants to borrow PHP10,000 as additional capital since she does not have enough money to assist her business.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Rorn T. (pictured) is 27 years old and her husband is 34. They are good parents who are very responsible to their three children, all of whom attend school.

This humble couple currently earns their income by catching fish, which they then sell. They get up while the sky is still dark to go to fishing on Tunle Sap Lake, where the fish are plentiful.

Currently, the family can't catch as many fish as they could previously because their fishing tools often break. Thus, Rorn T. is applying for a loan to be used to buy additional fishing tools for their fishing ventures.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing tools

loans.name: Hoyo Del Toro - Group 4

texts.en:
Juana E. is the group coordinator for these five entrepreneurs. She and her husband have one child living with them at home. Their other two children, ages 23 and 25, live independently.

Juana barely got to elementary school, so she has learned to use her own skills to generate income. Right now she sells various food items at her house for daily cooking. She plans on using this loan to buy more food to sell. She believes that being part of this group and repaying loans to Esperanza will help her grow as a businesswoman.

Juana and her friends live in a small community called Hoyo del Toro. This is a small "batey" (a sugar workers' town) on the outskirts of San Pedro D. Macoris. It is surrounded by large sugar cane fields belonging to a private company. Because of its isolated location, it is rather difficult for people in Hoyo del Toro to conduct business. Sometimes they travel elsewhere on market days to sell.

Please help us support Juana and her fellow borrowers with this Kiva loan.

Thank you!

loans.use: To restock her saleable food items inventory

loans.name: Sang's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people. Its leader, Mrs. S., 43, makes a living selling various grocery products, such as cooking ingredients, plastic products, and sweets (candies). She started the business four years ago, and currently earns approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. Mrs. S. has four children, all four of them are still living in the family home and are attending school.

Currently, Mrs. S. has sold nearly all the grocery items from her store. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to restore the quantity of inventory to her grocery store.

The other three borrowers are:

K., 26, who is a housewife who also needs a loan to buy a motor to replace the existing one;

K., 56, who is a construction worker and needs money to repair her old house;

and S., 24, who is a worker for a fish market and requests a loan to buy a motor for her family's transportation needs.

All of the borrowers live in Chong Kneas Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To restore the inventory of her grocery store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda U. is from the city of Cagayan de Oro. She is 44 years old. Erlinda is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business venture by selling bananas. Erlinda is just starting this business.

In 2008, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional bananas to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This loan will be the secnd loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Monico

texts.en:
Monico M. is from the city of Cagayan de Oro, Philippines. He is 43 years old. Monico is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Monico owns and operates a mini-restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving local foods to customers in the local community. Monico has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from his business.

Monico joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and enable him to engage in business activities. Monico has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. Monico is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP that will be used to purchase food and drinks for the mini-restaurant. This will be the second loan that Monico has taken from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for the mini-restaurant

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas S., age 29, is married and is the mother of one lovely young child who is enrolled in the local primary school. She owns a store in the local market where she sells different kinds of souvenirs for tourists. Most of her customers are foreigners who come to visit her community. Her husband, who works as a goldsmith, also contributes to the family's income.

The family has been facing difficulty with transportation for a long time because of they do not own a vehicle. Therefore, S. has decided to seek a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner, HKL, to purchase a motorcycle for family's driving needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for family's driving needs

loans.name: Adeltrudez

texts.en:
Adeltrudez M. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 59 years old. Adeltrudez is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Adeltrudez owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store where she sellis a variety of different products in the local community. Adeltrudez has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Adeltrudez joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and enable her to engage in business activities. Adeltrudez has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Adeltrudez is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her sari-sari store. This will be the second loan that Adeltrudez has taken from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to meet her family's basic needs.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn D. is from Cagayan de Oro, Philippines. She is 26 years old. Genalyn is single. To make a living, Genalyn sells firewood. Genalyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Genalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and enable her to engage in business activities. Genalyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan that Genalyn has taken from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kaev

texts.en:
Kaev S. was born in 1977. She is a married woman. She lives in Siem Reap Province. She has three children who are single but who cannot earn money to help meet the family's living expenses.

Since 1979, Kaev S. has run a business selling fish in local fish market, and is currently earning an average of $5 each day. Her husband helps her in the business selling fish. Beside their current work, the couple has cultivated a rice crop.

Because fish selling is the main way that the family earns money, to make additional income, Kaev S. would like a loan to purchase more fresh fish to sell.

Kaev S. and her husband appear in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Liem

texts.en: Liem T. is 50 years old and his wife, Thai, is age 47. They live in the province of Siem Reap. To cover the family's daily expenses more sufficiently, the couple has rented a store in the local market where they sell fresh fish for a profit. They have five children, one of whom is married and is ready began a new family. The others are single. Because the family lacks the capital to expand their business, Liem T. has requested a loan of $600 to be used to order additional fish from their supplier to sell.

loans.use: To order additional fish from their supplier to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn N. is from Cagayan de Oro, Philippines. She is 27 years old. Jocelyn is married and has three young children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to enable her to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana Q. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 32 years old. Luciana is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Luciana sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Luciana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Luciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to enable her to engage in business activities. Luciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating a pump boat for fishing. Luciana is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase an additional fishing boat. This will be Luciana's fourth loan from GDMPC.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an additional fishing boat

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru: Улугбеку – 26 лет. Женат и отец 2-х детей. Он занимается продажей разных видов ковров. Он торгует на рынке  «Джума-базар», а в воскресенье на рынок «Якшанбе-базар». Улугбек закупает товар из Турции, а часть товара он закупает из местного производства Кайракумского Коврового Комбината. Он ездит за товаром 1 раз в месяц. Улугбек за свой кредит хочет закупить еще товара для увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Ulugbek is 26 years old, married and has 2 children. He is involved in sales of various types of rugs. He sells at the Djuma-bazar market and at the Yakshanbe-bazar on Sundays. Ulugbek buys his merchandise from Turkey. Some of his merchandise is manufactured locally at the Kayrakum Rug Factory. He travels for his goods once per month. Ulugbek wants to use this loan to purchase more merchandise in order to increase his product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding product assortment

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна - молодая женщина 1975 года рождения. Замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Занимается продажей женских сумок, портмоне и прочих аксессуаров на рынке "Панчшанбе" на втором этаже, магазин № 213 и 224. Мавзуна закупает товар из города Бишкека. Она ездит за товаром 1 раз в месяц. Недавно она ездила за товаром. Мавзуна кредитуется у нас пол года. Это ее второй займ. Первый займ она закончила успешно. Мавзуна благодарна кредитным организациям за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Born in 1975, Mavzuna is a young married woman, who has one child. She is involved in sales of women’s purses, portfolios and other accessories at the Panshanbe market, stores 213 and 224 on the second floor. Mavzuna buys her merchandise in the city of Bishkek. She travels there once per month and recently went there for her goods. Mavzuna has been a borrower with us for six months. This is her second loan. She successfully repaid her first loan. Mavzuna is grateful to the lending organizations for the financial assistance.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of women's purses

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm P., 40 years old, is a vegetable grower from the Pursat Province. She runs her business on her own farmland where she grows different kinds of vegetables like cabbages, potatoes, and morning glories. She currently earns an average of $2 a day and has been running the business for more than four years. Morm P. is married to Mr. Thouk Thoeun who helps her with the farmwork. She has now seven children: four are single and the other three are married and live away from the family home. Morm P. hopes to earn other income by investing as a wine distiller. Due to the lack of capital, she has decided to request a loan from Kiva to purchase distilling material and rice to make wine. She will use the rest of the loan to buy piglets and whatever is leftover from the distilling wine for her family's pigs eating.

loans.use: To buy distilling material and rice to make wine and to buy a piglet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao K. (pictured) is 37 years old and lives in the Pursat Province. She and her husband earn a living raising pigs in a stall behind their house and selling them for slaughter six months after they begin raising them. Besides the pig-raising business, they always cultivate rice during the farming season, which is approaching. The couple has been married for years but they do not have children. Sao K. will use the loan to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en: Mrs. Nguon R. is 29 years old, Her husband, Phoun, (pictured) is age 28. They live in Pursat Province where they own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. They grow rice and have two crops per year, in both the dry and rainy seasons. The young couple has given birth to three children, who arw minors(jA;PVI,[; and are still not enrolled in school. The family faces difficulty with transportation, they always spend a lot of money for touring needs. Therefore, Nguon R. is applying for a loan to buy a used motorbike in order to make the family's transportation easier.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike

loans.name: Muhammad Tamim Group

texts.en: This is the M. Tamim group, led by M. Tamim. There are three members of this group. M.  Tamim and Zheuduin are seeking loans for their general stores. Bebe Del Jan has a tailoring business. They all hope to expand their businesses with this loan of 30000 Afghani, and are happy to apply for a loan that helps support entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Mrs. Hak D. is 22 and just married to Mr. Chanthou, 22. They have no children. They both live in Pursat Province, where they have jobs as rice farmers. They use their own farmland to grow rice crops, which they plant twice a year, including the rainy and dry seasons. To help meet the hard physical labor of farming work, Hak D. is applying for a loan to buy a pair of water buffalo in order to plow the farmland and to raise its offspring in the future.

loans.use: To buy a pair of water buffalo in order to plow the farmland

loans.name: Aqelah Group

texts.en: This is the Aqelah group, led by Aqelah. There are four members. They are requesting a loan of 40,000 Afghani. Aqelah and Salema would like to purchase a new sewing machine for their tailoring business. Bibi Zahara will use her portion to purchase materials for her husband’s mechanic business. Zaryn Gull would like to help her son expand his general store. With this loan they will improve their businesses and support their families, making a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: improve their businesses

loans.name: Fareuda Group

texts.en:
Fareuda is the leader of this group of three members. The group would like to take out a loan in the amount of 30,000 Afghani, and they have the following business improvement goals:

- Fareuda wants to obtain a loan for her husband's spare-parts car shop.

- Naiada would like to receive a loan on behalf of her brother, who is a taxi driver.

- Zheu Gul is requesting a loan for the business use of her husband, who is also a taxi driver.

All the group members express their grateful admiration for this process.

loans.use: For business improvement and expansion

loans.name: Rusembe 2 East Nyago Evelyn Group

texts.en:
Evelyn N. is a 28 year old old business lady. She is married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

Evelyn has been in business for two years but does not have sufficient capital. She will use this loan to purchase charcoal and food stuff, such as cassava, bananas and sweet potatoes, to add stock to her business and earn more profit.

She is a hardworking lady whose dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal and food stuff.

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru:
Сангов Исматулло,  ему 47 лет, женат и имеет 6 детей. Предпринимательством занимается семь лет и на данный момент торгует овощами на центральном  рынке города Вахдат. У него много клиентов. Каждый день с ближайших районов приезжают клиенты, чтоб закупит у него товар. В его ассортименте разные сорта картофели, моркови, капуст и луков. 
Для увеличения ассортимента и товарооборота, хочет получить займ в сумме 1500 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ismatullo S. is 47 years old, married and has six children. Mr. S. has been working in sales for the last seven years and currently sells vegetables at the central market in the city of Vakhdat. He has a lot of steady clients. Every day clients come from neighboring areas to purchase produce from him. He mainly sells different types of potatoes, carrots, cabbage and onions. Mr. S. would like to expand his inventory and for this purpose he wants to take out a loan of 1500 somoni for the next 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of produce

loans.name: Rusembe 2 East Kunihira Betty Group

texts.en:
Betty K. is 26 year old business lady. She is married with three kids and one dependent, who are all in school. She has had a retail shop for over three years but her profits have decreased because of insufficient capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase items such as bags of maize flour, sugar, salt, ground nuts, and tea leafs for her shop in bulk in order to meet her customer demand.

Her dream is to build a bigger house than the one she is staying in.

loans.use: To purchase food items in bulk.

loans.name: Jan Mohammad Group

texts.en: Jan M. is the group leader of Jan M. group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses. They want to expand their businesses and make them larger. Jan M. and Shazada want to take a loan for their bakery business. They want to complete there stock and buy wood,wheat,and make there bakery larger to attract more customers and export more bread in to town and hotels . Shammail wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy a new machine for her business. Kamelah wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of selling of fuel so he can expand his business. With this loan, they can collectively expand their businesses and make a better future for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To purchase stock for the business

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед Давлатов проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Чамшед более 6 лет занимается занимается земледелием, т.е. посевом риса. Собрав рис продает на рынке. Этот вид бизнеса является основным источником дохода. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить семена для посева, и в дальнейшем продать рис.
texts.en:
Jamshed D. lives in the Tursun-Zoda region of Tajikistan. He is 29 years old, married and has one child. Jamshed has been growing rice for the last six years, which he sells at the local market. His farming is the main source of income for the family and Jamshed would like to use this loan to buy seeds for planting and subsequently sell the rice he grows from them.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Rusembe 2 East Nyamaizi Janate Group

texts.en:
Janate N. is a 38 year old business lady. She is married with three children and also looks after three orphans. All the children are going to school.

She has been selling used clothes and mats for over ten years. She will use this loan to purchase used clothes to sell and materials for making mats.

She is a hardworking lady whose dream is to complete her house.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes and materials for making mats.

loans.name: Fareuba Group

texts.en:
Fareuba is the group leader of Fareuba group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for their business.

Fareuba wants to take a loan for her husband for animal husbandry. Khlda wants to take a loan for her husband's general store. Tahera wants to take a loan for her brother who is a farmer. Saleema wants to take a loan for a bead working business. They are requested a group loan of 56000 AFN. They are very happy for this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For animal husbandry

loans.name: Naim

texts.ru: Давлатмуродов Наим занимается земледелием. Сажает семена риса, выращивает и продает. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 7 лет. Проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить семена риса, для посева. И в дальнейшем собрав, продать.
texts.en:
Naim D. is a rice farmer. He plants rice from seed and then grows it to sell. He has been doing this for over 7 years. Naim lives in the Tursunzade area. He is 29 years old, married with 2 children. He is requesting the credit to buy rice seed to plant and then harvest and sell.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Buy  Rice Seed

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
"My husband and I are now preparing for our next planting. We have been busy preparing everything, the labor as well as the equipment to use. We started farming since the start of our marriage. Our harvest is mainly our source of income to pay the school, books, and other needs of our five children," says Helen D., a farmer from Agusan Del Sur in Mindanao.

She would like a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI (a Kiva field partner). She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and other farm inputs.

CEVI is helping farmers sustain their livelihoods. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rusembe 2 West Kiza Monica Group

texts.en:
Monica K. is a 28 year old single mother of three children and a business lady. She also looks after two dependents. All her children go to school.

She has been in her business for over four years. She will use this loan to purchase fresh food, such as cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, bananas, and beans.

Monica is hardworking. Her dream is to expand her business and work hard to earn enough profit to construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase fresh food to sell.

loans.name: Venibeb

texts.en:
"I started farming when I was a small kid. My father taught me everything from sowing the seeds to harvesting the grains. I learned also some techniques to achieve better yield in my crops. Now, that I am married to a farmer, I work my very best to help him in the farm and provide all their needs", says Venibeb B., 32-year old mother of two children. 

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase complete fertilizers, herbicides and ammonium sulfate. The loan will really help him improve his harvest and his income for the family as well.

Through CEVI, he is able to sustain his livelihood. CEVI provides all their clients not just loans. They also include training and insurance coverage as part of their services.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers, herbicides and ammonium sulfate

loans.name: Haytalah Group

texts.en:
Haytalah is the group leader of Haytalah group. There are five members in this group. All of them would like to receive money to purchase more materials for their businesses to make a good income for their families in future.

Haytalah wants to take a loan for his business as a jeweler and he wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. Hamaytalah wants to take a loan for his business as an electrician. Aziza wants to take a loan for her carpet weaving business. Malylah wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store. Khailada wants to take a loan for his tailoring business. They are very happy with this loan opportunity in Afghanistan.

loans.use: for his business as a jeweler

loans.name: Rusembe 2 West Kabiibi Dorothy Group

texts.en: K. Dorothy is 46 years old and married with ten kids who are going to school. She has owned a retail shop for 15 years. She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as maize flour, rice, sugar, soap, salt, wheat flour, cooking oil etc. She is active and hardworking. Her dream is to work hand-in-hand with her husband to build their house and form another business.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as maize flour, rice, sugar, soap, salt, wheat flour, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Rusembe 2 West Bulikilo Ever Group

texts.en: B. Ever is a 42-year-old single mother of three kids, all schooling, and she looks after two dependents. She has been selling charcoal and foodstuffs for over 10 years in which time she realized few profits. She is using the loan to purchase millet, charcoal, groundnuts, beans etc. She is a hard working woman whose dream is to construct a poultry house.

loans.use: To purchase millet, charcoal, ground nuts, beans etc.

loans.name: Yet

texts.en: Yet S., 53, is a local market seller. She sells items like dried fish and different kinds of fruit. She generates an average income of $2 each day to contribute to her family's daily living. She is a widowed mother who cares for three children who are single. Two of her daughters are employed: one is a garment worker and the last one is a shoe worker. Yet S. is a sacrificing lady who works hard at her business actions every day and she wants to encourage her unemployed child to attain a suitable job. In order to grow her business, she would like a loan from Kiva to order dried fish from wholesale suppliers to resell.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish at wholesale

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet B. is a very hard working business lady, 36 years old and married with two children who are at school. She has a stationery business and a Bar Business at Kasubi (near Makerere University). She is using the loan to purchase stationery commodities, sodas and wine for her Bar Business to fulfill her customer's demands. Her dream is to work hard and get profits that she can use to purchase new photocopier machines.

loans.use: To purchase stationery commodities, sodas and wine

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Z. Gladys is a very hard working business woman, 45 years old and married with four children. She has a Tailoring Business in her own house and she has a cow too. She is using the loan to purchase more clothes to fulfill customer demands and increase her business stock. Her dream is to work hard and purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en: K. Joyce, 56, is a hard working and devoted married mother of 12 children. Those children who are still in school are at the University and in Secondary school. Joyce also helps to care for three dependants. She is a business lady selling bananas and clothes. Being that she sells from Akashayi in Ibaare trading centre, she is able to manage both businesses. This is Joyce’s sixth loan and her loans have always helped her in buying more fertilizers and manure for her banana plantation plus buying more clothes; and as a result, she has been able to increase her monthly profits to 150,000 shillings because of her quality matooke and clothes for sale. She has a dream of having a happy and united family as well as having business expansion and profit increase. Joyce needs a loan to help with improving her banana plantation by employing manpower and buying fertilizers.

loans.use: Manpower, fertilizer and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
The group of borrowers consists of three people. Its leader, C. is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and their four children who are of school age. The house where they live is their own. She works selling fresh fish in a stall at the market. She gets up very early, at 2 am, to buy at the fish store where the fishermen bring the fish. Later she sells this in the market until 11 am. C. has a number of clients who eat her fish and continually visit her stall. She is happy with her work because each day she finishes selling all the fish she brings. She will use the loan money to grow watermelon on her own farmland and to purchase more fish to sell. The other borrowers who have joined this loan are:
Mrs. T., a grocery seller, who is looking for a loan to expand her business size.
Mr. P. who will use the loan to grow crops during the farming season.

All borrowers live in Kampong Chhnang Province.

loans.use: To grow watermelon and buy more fish

loans.name: Kiganda Central Nyangoma Ben Group

texts.en: N. Ben is a married lady, 34, and a proud mother of four children all at school. She sells new clothes and she has been selling new clothes for over seven years. She will use the loan to purchase trousers, shirts, kids’ clothing, traditional wear like Gomes’s, bitegi etc for sale. She is an active lady whose dream is to complete her house.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: "Farming is our livelihood. Now, we need materials like tractors to plow the field for our next planting. We only have a small parcel of land. This is what we till to feed and clothe our family,” says Violeta W., 55-year old mother of four children. She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase seed, complete fertilizers and herbicides. The loan will truly help her achieve maximum harvest and better income for her family as well. CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase seed, complete fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Hem's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of three people. Its leader, Mr. Hem S., is age 47 and he lives with his wife and their six children. He makes a living selling various grocery products, such as cooking ingredients, plastic products, and sweets (candies). He has operated this business since 1985, and currently earns approximately $4 per day.

On the other hand, he and his wife also cultivate a rice crop during the farming season. Hem S. is applying for a loan to spend on plowing his own farmland and to buy additional grocery inventory to sell.

The other two borrowers are:

Mr. N. is a firewood seller, who is seeking for a loan to plow a field in order to grow a crop.

Mrs. N. is a rice farmer, who requests a loan to begin raising pigs.

They all live in the province of Kampong Chhnang.

loans.use: To plow his farmland and buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Kiganda Central Asimwe Sarah Group

texts.en: A. Sarah is 30 years of age, and the single mother of two children, both schooling. She has operated a restaurant, cooking food, for over six years now. She is using the loan to purchase food for her restaurant like bananas, maize flour, millet flour, meat, chicken, milk, drinks, etc. She serves her community and most especially the travelers who check in for the meals. Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase food for her restaurant

loans.name: Elona

texts.en: Elona L. is from the village of Purok 3, Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. Elona operates a family member's business operating a motor cab for public transportation. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 7,200 PHP a month. In 2008, Elona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elona is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase an additional motorcycle. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for her children's education and for her family's basic needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an additional motorcycle

loans.name: Mellie

texts.en: Mellie A. is from the town of Mantik, Tangub City. She is 50 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children. Mellie owns and operates a business fishing and selling fish. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mellie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for fishing. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for basic family needs and for her children's education. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for fishing

loans.name: Jorenda

texts.en: "We started tilling a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm and have benefited much from it. We are able to provide food for our family and send our children to school. My husband and I dream of buying another farm. This is to grow our income to support our family‘s growing needs,” says Jorenda N., 39-year-old mother of four children. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy complete fertilizers, herbicides and seed. She is also interested in venturing into other lines of business. CEVI helps small businesses to grow. It provides its clients not only with credit, but with training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers, herbicides and seed

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. She is 55 years old and married with five children. She hopes for the loan of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng P. is a villager in Roeusey Srouk village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows vegetables. In his growing, he faces a problem because he does not have enough money to buy vegetable seed and other supplies to grow them on the field. In order to deal this problem, he decided to request a loan.

His wife, Mrs. Kong Koeun, is a housewife who does housework. Mr. Heng P. is 49 years old and the father of seven children, one of whom is a banana seller while another is a jasmine seller. Two of them are laborers and help their father’s work and the remainder are attending the local school. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed and other supplies for his field

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en: Nieva M. is from the town of Santa Maria, Tangub city. She is 50 years old, married, and has five school-aged and adult children. Nieva operates a vulcanizing or repair shop, repairing vehicles. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Nieva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nieva is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools for her repair shop. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for her children's education. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools for repairing vehicles

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana has owned a small grocery store in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for ten years. She belongs to Msikitini group loan (Group code 2029). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $125. Every day she works at her business for nine hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more grocery items to add to her current stock. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Juliana is 40 years old, married, and has five children: ages 20, 18, 13, 9 and 5. She also cares for seven additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to add to her current stock

loans.name: Savat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savat K. is the group leader for four members who all live in the Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in the province of Kandal.

She is a vendor of Chinese noodle soup. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. This is why she has decided to ask for a loan, specifically to purchase more beef, pork, and the other ingredients required for making the delicious soup she sells to her customers. She hopes to increase her income and her customer base.

Mrs. Savat K. is 51 years old and is a widow with three children. One of her children is a coffee seller and the others are employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To purchase beef, pork, and other ingredients for soup

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 38 years old and married with five children. She sells bags of garri (roasted cassava) and hawks her bags of garri from street to street in a wheelbarrow. She hopes for the loan of N40,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. She says  thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en: Bernadeth L. is from the village of Mantik, Tangub city. She is 37 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. Bernadeth owns and operates a business fishing and selling fish. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Bernadeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Bernadeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital to purchase materials for fishing such as a fishing net. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for basic family needs and for her children's education. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fishing items such as a net

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 27 years old and single without a child. She is also a part-time university student in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Helen sells provisions, drinks and clothes. She hopes for the loan of N40,000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anes Gull Group

texts.en:
Anes Gull is the group leader of Anes Gull group. There are five members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for there business.

Anes Gull and Hajera want to take a loan for there business of Bakery to buy stick and wheat for there business and change the designs of there bakery to contract with more restaurant and hotels. Also Azema and Khoja Mohammad want to take a loan for there business of work shop.  And buy necessary materials for there business. And Mier ways wants to take a loan for his business of stationary and he wants improve for his business. There requested a loan of 50000 afghani. there want to expand and progress for there business.          
They want to say that these loans are progressing the business and make larger business so they are use full they all wants to thank the kiva process in Afghanistan which supports poor people.

loans.use: there expand and progress for their business

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthy Doung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of twenty members, is located in the Dei Eth Koh Phos village of Kandal province. The group members plan to use the requested loan proceeds for a variety of purposes, depending on their business models.

Mrs. Chanthy D. was selected by her fellow group members to serve as the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a parcel of land on which she grows vegetables. Unfortunately, she is now facing a few significant obstacles: her field is infertile and there are many insects (which have damaged her vegetables). To solve these problems, she decided to ask for a loan in order to purchase fertilizer and pesticides, which she hopes will ensure that her land is more productive going forward. Her husband, Mr. Em Saran, is a hardworking man. Mrs. Chanthy D. is 32 years old and is the mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in the local school.

Mrs. Ol S. and Mrs. Kem Ie S. (both pictured) are not seeking a loan, but their husbands are requesting a portion of the loan proceeds.

loans.use: To expand and improve her farming operation by purchasing fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Tit

texts.en:
Mr. Tit B. is 30 years old and lives in the province of Siem Reap, where he has been establishing a small family with two other family members. He is married with one young child who is enrolled in the primary school. His wife who works selling fish in the local market

He owns a motorbike that he uses to run a taxi to earn a living. He generates an average profit of $3 a day and the profit he uses to manage his family's daily living expenses. Currently, Tit B. can't earn as much income as before because his motorbike has often broken down . He will use the whole amount of the loan to replace his old motorcycle.

Tit B. was not available for the photograph and so his wife is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To replace his old motorcycle

loans.name: Analie

texts.en: "My husband and I are tilling a 3-hectare (7.5-acre) farm. We never mind the labor or working under the heat of the sun, plowing the wet field just to ensure an abundant harvest from our farm," says Analie M., 30-year-old mother of five children. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm necessities. The loan will really help a lot, especially in improving the soil condition of her farm and protecting the crops from damaging insects. By doing so, Mrs. M. believes that she will be able to improve their yield. CEVI helps small businesses to grow. It provides its clients with not just loans - it includes training and insurance coverage as part of its services.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm necessities

loans.name: Kiganda Central Nalubega Florence Group

texts.en: N. Florence is aged 28 and is a single mother of three children, all schooling. She sells new clothes and she has been in her business for over seven years. She is using the loan to purchase more clothes to sell: that’s ladies, gents and kids clothes. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to develop her business and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase more new clothes to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina has owned a small grocery store in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for twenty years. She belongs to Ngome north group loan (Group code 2032). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $80. Every day she works at her business for four hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more local beer for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Amina is married, and has five children: ages 36, 34, 23, 12 and 9. She also cares for three additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more local beer for resale

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud C., 62, lives in the village of Pines, Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental, where she is married and has 12 adult-aged children. To make a living, Salud owns and operates a "sari-sari" or retail store which primarily sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. to the local community. Salud has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Salud joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from the organization and is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari." This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. Salud plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jimma

texts.en:
Jimma E., a 42-year-old married mother of one child, lives in the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin Misamis Occidental, where she owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store. The store’s main source of income is derived from selling shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc. to the local community. Jimma has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jimma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC and is now requesting a new loan, her third from the organization, of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari." Jimma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to meet her family's basic needs.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Kiganda Central Kiza Jolly Group

texts.en: K. Jolly is a 43-year-old single mother of six children. Three of her children are schooling and she has two other dependents who are also in school. She has been operating her business of selling bananas for more than 10 years. She is using the loan to purchase bananas on a wholesale basis to add stock to her business. She loads a full truck and sells in the market. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to build a permanent house.

loans.use: To purchase bananas in wholesale

loans.name: Mrs Rim Choem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is for a group of 24 people living in Mkak village in Kandal province, and the group will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs Rim C. is 57 years old and the village bank president. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a garment factory employee while the other is a construction worker. Mrs Rim C. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice, and she needs fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

Eighteen members in this group have end-of-term (EoT) loans. This means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. (The rest have monthly payment loans.) EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. An EoT loan allows the borrower to repay portions of the principal whenever he or she is financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 30 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase a grinding machine to enable her grind pepper, tomatoes and beans for her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase purchase a grinding machine

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth has been a bites (bread-like rolls) seller in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for 10 years. She belongs to the Msikitini group loan. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Magreth is married and has a 16 year old. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Kossi Kouma

texts.fr: Ce monsieur réside dans le quartier d’adidogomé, un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Il est marié et est père de 02 enfants. L’activité qu’il exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce des matériaux de construction. La plupart de ses clients sont des entrepreneurs, des maçons. Actuellement une partie de son stock est épuisée. Il souhaite se réapprovisionner et demande à WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des produits de quincaillerie.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in Adidogomé, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. He is married and the father of two. The work he does that allows him to provide for this family involves commerce in construction materials. Most of his customers are entrepreneurs, masons. Currently, a portion of his inventory is exhausted. He would like to stock up again and is asking WAGES for his first loan to buy hardware products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hardware products

loans.name: Sharifchon

texts.ru: Шарифчон – молодой мужчина 1982 года рождения. Женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. Занимается продажей прохладительных напитков на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Он продает газированные напитки и соки. Он закупает товар у оптовиков из рынка «Панчшанбе» и продает в розницу на рынке «Фаровон». Шарифчон кредитуется в нашей организации впервые. Он очень благодарен кредитной организации за эту поддержку.
texts.en:
Sharifchon Y. is a young man born in 1982. He is married with 1 child. He sells cold drinks in the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. He sells both soft drinks and juices. He buys the drinks wholesale at the Panchshanbe market and then sells them at the Farovon market. Sharifchon is a new member of the credit organization and is very grateful for the support he receives from it.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Increase Sales

loans.name: Faryda Group

texts.en:
Faryda is the group leader of the four-member Faryda group. The group members live in District 11, Kabul, Afghanistan, and are requesting money for their businesses.

Faryda wants to take a loan for her tailoring business in order to enlarge her shop.

Pary wants to take a loan for her husband’s fuel-selling business. He wants to make his shop larger.

Hamma wants to take a loan for her home-based bead-working business so that she can buy the necessary materials for her work.

Hafeza wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store. He wants to buy goods for his shop.

The group want to thank Kiva and Kiva partner, AFS, for their help for poor people.

loans.use: To enlarge her tailoring business

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kun P. is a 25-year-old who has been married to Mr. Nouv Khoeun (pictured) who is age 27. Kun P. now has three children: two daughters and one son. All three of them are attending the local school.

Mrs. Kun P. is a crop farmer, growing rice, vegetables, and some flowers. She sells her produce to buyers every two months when her crops mature. To alleviate the hard physical labor, her husband works with her in growing the crops.

Kun P. will use the loan to purchase two water buffalo which she can use to plow a field and rent them out to other farmers as an additional income source.

loans.use: To purchase two water buffalo

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a 36-year-old woman. She is married with seven children: two are currently in school. She lives with her family at Dorma in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.

She is a food vendor and sells banku with fried fish. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper. She has been in business for five years now.

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise increased income to support her children’s education. She belongs to the village called ‘Gyedie mu Aba’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther I. sells drinks, provisions and foodstuffs. She is 39 years old and married with four children. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is fifty years old and is married with five children who are all in school. She is married to Mr. A. who is a farmer in the community where they live together with the children.

Adwoa works very hard to provide food for her family. She sells used women’s shoes and slippers and sells through hawking: that is, house to house to house selling. She obtains her stock of goods from Kumasi and retails to her customers through hawking.

Adwoa treks to Kumasi every week for her stock and her reason is that she doesn’t have enough money to buy in bulk. Adwoa is therefore requesting your loan support to avoid frequent traveling to Kumasi. With the loan she wants to buy more slippers and shoes to increase her stock. She belongs to the village called ‘Gyedie mu Aba’.

loans.use: To buy more used women's shoes and slippers to sell

loans.name: Bujwaha Asiina Safina Group

texts.en: Assina Safina is 27 years old and a single mother of two children, one of whom is schooling. She deals in shoes; she has been selling shoes for three years. She will use this loan to purchase gents’ shoes, ladies' shoes, and children's shoes. She is a hard-working lady who is hoping for a change in her business. Her dream is to purchase a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the village of Talisay, Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Josephine is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector, operating a sari-sari (general store). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is selling soap, shampoo, toothpaste etc. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell in her sari-sari (general store). This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for her children's education and for her family's basic needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yawo Ganyo

texts.fr:
ce jeune homme a appris le métier de la couture, à la fin de son apprentissage il a ouvert son propre atelier de couture, il achète des tissus basins et confectionne des vêtements appelés « boubous » qu’il revend à ses clients.
 Il réalise ainsi de grosses recettes. Sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour, il veut par conséquent agrandir son activité raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 20 tissus basins pour confectionner de nouveaux modèles de boubous.
texts.en:
This is a young man who learned the trade of tailoring. After finishing his apprenticeship, he opened his own workshop. He buys damask cloth and makes clothing called boubous (long, loose-fitting outfits) that he sells to his customers. And so his gross income is large. His customers are increasing day by day. He consequently wants to expand his business, and this is why he's requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 20 lengths of damask cloth to make new styles of boubous.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy damask cloth

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa Y. is 39 years old. She is married and a mother of five kids. Yaa lives with her husband and children at Dorma town. Yaa is a food vendor who prepares and sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains that are cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. Yaa has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. In addition, she also sells raw food like bags of maize at the market square of Dorma. She has been selling kenkey for five years now.

Yaa wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to earn more income to support her children, especially in their education. She belongs to the village called ‘Gyedie mu Aba’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Bujwaha Ntegega Rosemary Group

texts.en: N. Rosemary is 26 years old. She is a married lady with three children who all go to school. She has been operating her business of selling used clothes for over 3 years. She will use this loan to purchase used clothing to sell. Her dream is to work hard and construct a residential house.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a retired civil servant. He has a pig farm where he rears pigs. Peter is 61 years old and married with 2 children. He hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more pigs to sell. He says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa Y., who is widely known as ‘mother,' is 30 years old and married to Mr. Y., who is a farmer. She is expecting her first child soon. She makes a living selling cereals and grain such as maize in the local market in Dorma, a town in Ghana's Brong Ahafo region. She is applying for this loan to buy additional stocks of maize so that she can expand her business and increase sales. She says her biggest challenge is frequent increases in the price of maize, which force her to work hard to buy just a few bags. She gets her stock in villages that surround Dorma and retails them to her customers.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of maize

loans.name: Naomie

texts.en:
Naomie B. is from the village of Tinaclaaan Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Naomie owns and  operates a general store which is known locally as a "sari-sari." She makes most of her income by selling a variety of different products to the people in her community. Naomie has been engaged in her business for over five years.

In 2005, Naomie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Naomie has successfully repaid previous loans from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan -- her ninth -- to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en:
"I used to be a laborer who worked all day to pay his bills. Now, I manage a small rice farm. I use my harvest to feed and clothe my children, and want grow my farm and provide my children a good future," says George M., a 33-year-old father of two.

He has applied for this loan to buy fertilizers and herbicides. "With my loan, I will be able to improve my harvest and income as well," he said.

CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage also.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Débora

texts.fr:
